member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent
member.summary: A light component that has parallel rays. Will provide a uniform lighting across any affected surface (eg. The Sun). This will affect all objects in the defined light-mass importance volume.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.bEnableLightShaftOcclusion
member.summary: Whether to occlude fog and atmosphere inscattering with screenspace blurred occlusion from this light.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.OcclusionMaskDarkness
member.summary: Controls how dark the occlusion masking is, a value of 1 results in no darkening term.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.OcclusionDepthRange
member.summary: Everything closer to the camera than this distance will occlude light shafts.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.LightShaftOverrideDirection
member.summary: Can be used to make light shafts come from somewhere other than the light's actual direction. This will only be used when non-zero. It does not have to be normalized.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.DynamicShadowDistanceMovableLight
member.summary: How far Cascaded Shadow Map dynamic shadows will cover for a movable light, measured from the camera. A value of 0 disables the dynamic shadow.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.DynamicShadowDistanceStationaryLight
member.summary: How far Cascaded Shadow Map dynamic shadows will cover for a stationary light, measured from the camera. A value of 0 disables the dynamic shadow.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.DynamicShadowCascades
member.summary: Number of cascades to split the view frustum into for the whole scene dynamic shadow. More cascades result in better shadow resolution, but adds significant rendering cost.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.CascadeDistributionExponent
member.summary: Controls whether the cascades are distributed closer to the camera (larger exponent) or further from the camera (smaller exponent). An exponent of 1 means that cascade transitions will happen at a distance proportional to their resolution.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.CascadeTransitionFraction
member.summary: Proportion of the fade region between cascades. Pixels within the fade region of two cascades have their shadows blended to avoid hard transitions between quality levels. A value of zero eliminates the fade region, creating hard transitions. Higher values increase the size of the fade region, creating a more gradual transition between cascades. The value is expressed as a percentage proportion (i.e. 0.1 = 10% overlap). Ideal values are the smallest possible which still hide the transition. An increased fade region size causes an increase in shadow rendering cost.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.ShadowDistanceFadeoutFraction
member.summary: Controls the size of the fade out region at the far extent of the dynamic shadow's influence. This is specified as a fraction of DynamicShadowDistance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.bUseInsetShadowsForMovableObjects
member.summary: Stationary lights only: Whether to use per-object inset shadows for movable components, even though cascaded shadow maps are enabled. This allows dynamic objects to have a shadow even when they are outside of the cascaded shadow map, which is important when DynamicShadowDistanceStationaryLight is small. If DynamicShadowDistanceStationaryLight is large (currently > 8000), this will be forced off. Disabling this can reduce shadowing cost significantly with many movable objects.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.FarShadowCascadeCount
member.summary: 0: no DistantShadowCascades, otherwise the count of cascades between WholeSceneDynamicShadowRadius and DistantShadowDistance that are covered by distant shadow cascades.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.FarShadowDistance
member.summary: Distance at which the far shadow cascade should end. Far shadows will cover the range between 'Dynamic Shadow Distance' and this distance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.DistanceFieldShadowDistance
member.summary: Distance at which the ray traced shadow cascade should end. Distance field shadows will cover the range between 'Dynamic Shadow Distance' this distance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.LightSourceAngle
member.summary: Light source angle in degrees, used for dynamic shadowing methods. Currently only Ray Traced Distance Field shadows and Capsule shadows support area shadows, and therefore make use of LightSourceAngle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.TraceDistance
member.summary: Determines how far shadows can be cast, in world units. Larger values increase the shadowing cost.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.LightmassSettings
member.summary: The Lightmass settings for this object.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.bCastModulatedShadows
member.summary: Whether the light should cast modulated shadows from dynamic objects (mobile only). Also requires Cast Shadows to be set to True.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UDirectionalLightComponent.ModulatedShadowColor
member.summary: Color to modulate against the scene color when rendering modulated shadows. (mobile only)

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent
member.summary: Used to create fogging effects such as clouds but with a density that is related to the height of the fog.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent.FogDensity
member.summary: Global density factor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent.DirectionalInscatteringExponent
member.summary: Controls the size of the directional inscattering cone, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light with bUsedAsAtmosphereSunLight enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent.DirectionalInscatteringStartDistance
member.summary: Controls the start distance from the viewer of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light with bUsedAsAtmosphereSunLight enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent.DirectionalInscatteringColor
member.summary: Controls the color of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light with bUsedAsAtmosphereSunLight enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent.FogHeightFalloff
member.summary: Height density factor, controls how the density increases as height decreases. Smaller values make the visible transition larger.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent.FogMaxOpacity
member.summary: Maximum opacity of the fog. A value of 1 means the fog can become fully opaque at a distance and replace scene color completely, A value of 0 means the fog color will not be factored in at all.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UExponentialHeightFogComponent.StartDistance
member.summary: Distance from the camera that the fog will start, in world units.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UFloatingPawnMovement
member.summary: FloatingPawnMovement is a movement component that provides simple movement for any Pawn class. Limits on speed and acceleration are provided, while gravity is not implemented. Normally the root component of the owning actor is moved, however another component may be selected (see SetUpdatedComponent()). During swept (non-teleporting) movement only collision of UpdatedComponent is considered, attached components will teleport to the end location ignoring collision.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFloatingPawnMovement.MaxSpeed
member.summary: Maximum velocity magnitude allowed for the controlled Pawn.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFloatingPawnMovement.Acceleration
member.summary: Acceleration applied by input (rate of change of velocity)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFloatingPawnMovement.Deceleration
member.summary: Deceleration applied when there is no input (rate of change of velocity)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFloatingPawnMovement.TurningBoost
member.summary: Setting affecting extra force applied when changing direction, making turns have less drift and become more responsive. Velocity magnitude is not allowed to increase, that only happens due to normal acceleration. It may decrease with large direction changes. Larger values apply extra force to reach the target direction more quickly, while a zero value disables any extra turn force.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFloatingPawnMovement.bPositionCorrected
member.summary: Set to true when a position correction is applied. Used to avoid recalculating velocity when this occurs.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UFont
member.summary: A font object, for use by Slate, UMG, and Canvas. A font can either be: * Runtime cached - The font contains a series of TTF files that combine to form a composite font. The glyphs are cached on demand when required at runtime. * Offline cached - The font contains a series of textures containing pre-baked cached glyphs and their associated texture coordinates.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.FontCacheType
member.summary: What kind of font caching should we use? This controls which options we see

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.Characters
member.summary: List of characters in the font. For a MultiFont, this will include all characters in all sub-fonts! Thus, the number of characters in this array isn't necessary the number of characters available in the font

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.Textures
member.summary: Textures that store this font's glyph image data //NOTE: Do not expose this to the editor as it has nasty crash potential

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.IsRemapped
member.summary: True if font is 'remapped'. That is, the character array is not a direct mapping to unicode values. Instead, all characters are indexed indirectly through the CharRemap array

member.summary: Font metrics.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.ImportOptions
member.summary: Options used when importing this font

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.NumCharacters
member.summary: Number of characters in the font, not including multiple instances of the same character (for multi-fonts). This is cached at load-time or creation time, and is never serialized.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.MaxCharHeight
member.summary: The maximum height of a character in this font. For multi-fonts, this array will contain a maximum character height for each multi-font, otherwise the array will contain only a single element. This is cached at load-time or creation time, and is never serialized.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UFont.ScalingFactor
member.summary: Scale to apply to the font.

member.summary: The default size of the font used for legacy Canvas APIs that don't specify a font size

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UGameInstance
member.summary: GameInstance: high-level manager object for an instance of the running game. Spawned at game creation and not destroyed until game instance is shut down. Running as a standalone game, there will be one of these. Running in PIE (play-in-editor) will generate one of these per PIE instance.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UGameViewportClient
member.summary: A game viewport (FViewport) is a high-level abstract interface for the platform specific rendering, audio, and input subsystems. GameViewportClient is the engine's interface to a game viewport. Exactly one GameViewportClient is created for each instance of the game. The only case (so far) where you might have a single instance of Engine, but multiple instances of the game (and thus multiple GameViewportClients) is when you have more than one PIE window running. Responsibilities: propagating input events to the global interactions list @see UGameViewportClient

member.summary: If enabled, streaming will be flushed each time garbage collection is triggered.

member.summary: If enabled, garbage collection will use multiple threads.

member.summary: If true, the engine will attempt to create clusters of objects for better garbage collection performance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UGarbageCollectionSettings.MergeGCClusters
member.summary: If true, when creating clusters, the clusters referenced from another cluster will get merged into one big cluster.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UGarbageCollectionSettings.NumRetriesBeforeForcingGC
member.summary: Maximum number of times GC can be skipped if worker threads are currently modifying UObject state. 0 = never force GC

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UGarbageCollectionSettings.MaxObjectsNotConsideredByGC
member.summary: Maximum Object Count Not Considered By GC. Works only in cooked builds.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UGarbageCollectionSettings.SizeOfPermanentObjectPool
member.summary: Size Of Permanent Object Pool (bytes). Works only in cooked builds.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UGarbageCollectionSettings.MaxObjectsInGame
member.summary: Maximum number of UObjects that can exist in cooked game. Keep this as small as possible.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UGarbageCollectionSettings.MaxObjectsInEditor
member.summary: Maximum number of UObjects that can exist in the editor game. Make sure this can hold enough objects for the editor and commadlets within reasonable limit.

member.summary: Reset to start. Sets time to zero and direction to 1.

member.summary: Clears the reference to UpdatedComponent, fires stop event, and stops ticking.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.Duration
member.summary: How long to take to move from the first point to the last (or vice versa)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.bPauseOnImpact
member.summary: If true, will pause movement on impact. If false it will behave as if the end of the movement range was reached based on the BehaviourType.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.BehaviourType
member.summary: Movement behaviour of the component

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.bForceSubStepping
member.summary: If true, forces sub-stepping to break up movement into discrete smaller steps to improve accuracy of the trajectory. Objects that move in a straight line typically do *not* need to set this, as movement always uses continuous collision detection (sweeps) so collision is not missed. Sub-stepping is automatically enabled when under the effects of gravity or when homing towards a target. @see MaxSimulationTimeStep, MaxSimulationIterations

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.OnInterpToReverse
member.summary: Called when InterpTo impacts something and reverse is enabled.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.OnInterpToStop
member.summary: Called when InterpTo has come to a stop.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.OnWaitBeginDelegate
member.summary: Called when InterpTo has come to a stop but will resume when possible.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.OnWaitEndDelegate
member.summary: Called when InterpTo has resumed following a stop.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.OnResetDelegate
member.summary: Called when InterpTo reached the end and reset back to start .

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.MaxSimulationTimeStep
member.summary: Max time delta for each discrete simulation step. Lowering this value can address issues with fast-moving objects or complex collision scenarios, at the cost of performance. WARNING: if (MaxSimulationTimeStep * MaxSimulationIterations) is too low for the min framerate, the last simulation step may exceed MaxSimulationTimeStep to complete the simulation. @see MaxSimulationIterations, bForceSubStepping

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UInterpToMovementComponent.MaxSimulationIterations
member.summary: Max number of iterations used for each discrete simulation step. Increasing this value can address issues with fast-moving objects or complex collision scenarios, at the cost of performance. WARNING: if (MaxSimulationTimeStep * MaxSimulationIterations) is too low for the min framerate, the last simulation step may exceed MaxSimulationTimeStep to complete the simulation. @see MaxSimulationTimeStep, bForceSubStepping

M:UnrealEngine.UKismetMathLibrary.ComposeTransforms(UnrealEngine.FTransform,UnrealEngine.FTransform)
member.summary: Compose two transforms in order: A * B. Order matters when composing transforms: A * B will yield a transform that logically first applies A then B to any subsequent transformation. Example: LocalToWorld = ComposeTransforms(DeltaRotation, LocalToWorld) will change rotation in local space by DeltaRotation. Example: LocalToWorld = ComposeTransforms(LocalToWorld, DeltaRotation) will change rotation in world space by DeltaRotation. @return New transform: A * B

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UKismetTextLibrary.AsCurrencyBase(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Generate an FText that represents the passed number as currency in the current culture. BaseVal is specified in the smallest fractional value of the currency and will be converted for formatting according to the selected culture. Keep in mind the CurrencyCode is completely independent of the culture it's displayed in (and they do not imply one another). For example: FText::AsCurrencyBase(650, TEXT("EUR")); would return an FText of "?6.50" in most English cultures (en_US/en_UK) and "6,50?" in Spanish (es_ES).

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.SetLightColor(UnrealEngine.FLinearColor,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set color of the light

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.SetIntensity(System.Single)
member.summary: Set intensity of the light

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.Temperature
member.summary: Color temperature in Kelvin of the blackbody illuminant. White (D65) is 6500K.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.bUseTemperature
member.summary: false: use white (D65) as illuminant.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.ShadowMapChannel
member.summary: Shadow map channel which is used to match up with the appropriate static shadowing during a deferred shading pass. This is generated during a lighting build.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.MinRoughness
member.summary: Min roughness effective for this light. Used for softening specular highlights.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.ShadowBias
member.summary: Controls how accurate self shadowing of whole scene shadows from this light are. At 0, shadows will start at the their caster surface, but there will be many self shadowing artifacts. larger values, shadows will start further from their caster, and there won't be self shadowing artifacts but object might appear to fly. around 0.5 seems to be a good tradeoff. This also affects the soft transition of shadows

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.ShadowSharpen
member.summary: Amount to sharpen shadow filtering

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.ContactShadowLength
member.summary: Length of screen space ray trace for sharp contact shadows. Zero is disabled.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.CastTranslucentShadows
member.summary: Whether the light is allowed to cast dynamic shadows from translucency.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.bCastShadowsFromCinematicObjectsOnly
member.summary: Whether the light should only cast shadows from components marked as bCastCinematicShadows. This is useful for setting up cinematic Movable spotlights aimed at characters and avoiding the shadow depth rendering costs of the background. Note: this only works with dynamic shadow maps, not with static shadowing or Ray Traced Distance Field shadows.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.bAffectDynamicIndirectLighting
member.summary: Whether the light should be injected into the Light Propagation Volume

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.LightingChannels
member.summary: Channels that this light should affect. These channels only apply to opaque materials, direct lighting, and dynamic lighting and shadowing.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.LightFunctionMaterial
member.summary: The light function material to be applied to this light. Note that only non-lightmapped lights (UseDirectLightMap=False) can have a light function.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.LightFunctionScale
member.summary: Scales the light function projection. X and Y scale in the directions perpendicular to the light's direction, Z scales along the light direction.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.IESTexture
member.summary: IES texture (light profiles from real world measured data)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.bUseIESBrightness
member.summary: true: take light brightness from IES profile, false: use the light brightness - the maximum light in one direction is used to define no masking. Use with InverseSquareFalloff. Will be disabled if a valid IES profile texture is not supplied.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.IESBrightnessScale
member.summary: Global scale for IES brightness contribution. Only available when "Use IES Brightness" is selected, and a valid IES profile texture is set

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.LightFunctionFadeDistance
member.summary: Distance at which the light function should be completely faded to DisabledBrightness. This is useful for hiding aliasing from light functions applied in the distance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.DisabledBrightness
member.summary: Brightness factor applied to the light when the light function is specified but disabled, for example in scene captures that use SceneCapView_LitNoShadows. This should be set to the average brightness of the light function material's emissive input, which should be between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.bEnableLightShaftBloom
member.summary: Whether to render light shaft bloom from this light. For directional lights, the color around the light direction will be blurred radially and added back to the scene. for point lights, the color on pixels closer than the light's SourceRadius will be blurred radially and added back to the scene.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.BloomScale
member.summary: Scales the additive color.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.BloomThreshold
member.summary: Scene color must be larger than this to create bloom in the light shafts.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.BloomTint
member.summary: Multiplies against scene color to create the bloom color.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.bUseRayTracedDistanceFieldShadows
member.summary: Whether to use ray traced distance field area shadows. The project setting bGenerateMeshDistanceFields must be enabled for this to have effect. Distance field shadows support area lights so they create soft shadows with sharp contacts. They have less aliasing artifacts than standard shadowmaps, but inherit all the limitations of distance field representations (only uniform scale, no deformation). These shadows have a low per-object cost (and don't depend on triangle count) so they are effective for distant shadows from a dynamic sun.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponent.RayStartOffsetDepthScale
member.summary: Controls how large of an offset ray traced shadows have from the receiving surface as the camera gets further away. This can be useful to hide self-shadowing artifacts from low resolution distance fields on huge static meshes.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.GetLightColor
member.summary: Gets the light color as a linear color

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.SetCastShadows(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether this light casts shadows

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.LightGuid
member.summary: GUID used to associate a light component with precomputed shadowing information across levels. The GUID changes whenever the light position changes.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.Intensity
member.summary: Total energy that the light emits. For point/spot lights with inverse squared falloff, this is in units of lumens. 1700 lumens corresponds to a 100W lightbulb. For other lights, this is just a brightness multiplier.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.LightColor
member.summary: Filter color of the light. Note that this can change the light's effective intensity.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.bAffectsWorld
member.summary: Whether the light can affect the world, or whether it is disabled. A disabled light will not contribute to the scene in any way. This setting cannot be changed at runtime and unbuilds lighting when changed. Setting this to false has the same effect as deleting the light, so it is useful for non-destructive experiments.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.CastShadows
member.summary: Whether the light should cast any shadows.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.CastStaticShadows
member.summary: Whether the light should cast shadows from static objects. Also requires Cast Shadows to be set to True.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.CastDynamicShadows
member.summary: Whether the light should cast shadows from dynamic objects. Also requires Cast Shadows to be set to True.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.bAffectTranslucentLighting
member.summary: Whether the light affects translucency or not. Disabling this can save GPU time when there are many small lights.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.bPrecomputedLightingIsValid
member.summary: The precomputed lighting for that light source is valid. It might become invalid if some properties change (e.g. position, brightness).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.IndirectLightingIntensity
member.summary: Scales the indirect lighting contribution from this light. A value of 0 disables any GI from this light. Default is 1.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.StaticEditorTexture
member.summary: Sprite for static light in the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.StaticEditorTextureScale
member.summary: Sprite scaling for static light in the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.DynamicEditorTexture
member.summary: Sprite for dynamic light in the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULightComponentBase.DynamicEditorTextureScale
member.summary: Sprite scaling for dynamic light in the editor.

member.summary: The UModel these surfaces come from.

member.summary: The master viewport containing this player's view.

member.summary: How to constrain perspective viewport FOV

member.summary: The class of PlayerController to spawn for players logging in.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.ULocalPlayer.bSentSplitJoin
member.summary: set when we've sent a split join request

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UMaterial
member.summary: A Material is an asset which can be applied to a mesh to control the visual look of the scene. In general, when light from the scene hits the surface, the shading model of the material is used to calculate how that light interacts with the surface.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.PhysMaterial
member.summary: Physical material to use for this graphics material. Used for sounds, effects etc.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.DiffuseColor
member.summary: Reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.EmissiveColor
member.summary: Emission.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.Opacity
member.summary: Transmission.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.MaterialDomain
member.summary: The domain that the material's attributes will be evaluated in. Certain pieces of material functionality are only valid in certain domains, for example vertex normal is only valid on a surface.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.BlendMode
member.summary: Determines how the material's color is blended with background colors.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.DecalBlendMode
member.summary: Defines how the GBuffer chanels are getting manipulated by a decal material pass. (only with MaterialDomain == MD_DeferredDecal)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.MaterialDecalResponse
member.summary: Defines how the material reacts on DBuffer decals (Affects look, performance and texture/sample usage). Non DBuffer Decals can be disabled on the primitive (e.g. static mesh)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.ShadingModel
member.summary: Determines how inputs are combined to create the material's final color.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.WorldPositionOffset
member.summary: Adds to world position in the vertex shader.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.WorldDisplacement
member.summary: Offset in world space applied to tessellated vertices.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TessellationMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplies the tessellation factors applied when a tessellation mode is set.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.SubsurfaceColor
member.summary: Inner material color, only used for ShadingModel=Subsurface

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.AmbientOcclusion
member.summary: output ambient occlusion to the GBuffer

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.Refraction
member.summary: output refraction index for translucent rendering Air:1.0 Water:1.333 Ice:1.3 Glass:~1.6 Diamond:2.42

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.CustomizedUVs
member.summary: These inputs are evaluated in the vertex shader and allow artists to do arbitrary vertex shader operations and access them in the pixel shader. When unconnected or hidden they default to passing through the vertex UVs.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bEnableSeparateTranslucency
member.summary: Indicates that the material should be rendered in the SeparateTranslucency Pass (not affected by DOF, requires bAllowSeparateTranslucency to be set in .ini).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bEnableMobileSeparateTranslucency
member.summary: Indicates that the translucent material should not be affected by bloom or DOF. (Note: Depth testing is not available)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bEnableResponsiveAA
member.summary: Indicates that the material should be rendered using responsive anti-aliasing. Improves sharpness of small moving particles such as sparks. Only use for small moving features because it will cause aliasing of the background.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bScreenSpaceReflections
member.summary: SSR on translucency

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TwoSided
member.summary: Indicates that the material should be rendered without backface culling and the normal should be flipped for backfaces.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.DitheredLODTransition
member.summary: Whether the material should support a dithered LOD transition.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.DitherOpacityMask
member.summary: Dither opacity mask. When combined with Temporal AA this can be used as a form of limited translucency which supports all lighting features.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bAllowNegativeEmissiveColor
member.summary: Whether the material should allow outputting negative emissive color values. Only allowed on unlit materials.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.NumCustomizedUVs
member.summary: Number of customized UV inputs to display. Unconnected customized UV inputs will just pass through the vertex UVs.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucencyLightingMode
member.summary: Sets the lighting mode that will be used on this material if it is translucent.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucencyDirectionalLightingIntensity
member.summary: Useful for artificially increasing the influence of the normal on the lighting result for translucency. A value larger than 1 increases the influence of the normal, a value smaller than 1 makes the lighting more ambient.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucentShadowDensityScale
member.summary: Scale used to make translucent shadows more or less opaque than the material's actual opacity.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucentSelfShadowDensityScale
member.summary: Scale used to make translucent self-shadowing more or less opaque than the material's shadow on other objects. This is only used when the object is casting a volumetric translucent shadow.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucentSelfShadowSecondDensityScale
member.summary: Used to make a second self shadow gradient, to add interesting shading in the shadow of the first.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucentSelfShadowSecondOpacity
member.summary: Controls the strength of the second self shadow gradient.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucentBackscatteringExponent
member.summary: Controls how diffuse the material's backscattering is when using the MSM_Subsurface shading model. Larger exponents give a less diffuse look (smaller, brighter backscattering highlight). This is only used when the object is casting a volumetric translucent shadow from a directional light.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucentMultipleScatteringExtinction
member.summary: Colored extinction factor used to approximate multiple scattering in dense volumes. This is only used when the object is casting a volumetric translucent shadow.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.TranslucentShadowStartOffset
member.summary: Local space distance to bias the translucent shadow. Positive values move the shadow away from the light.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bDisableDepthTest
member.summary: Whether to draw on top of opaque pixels even if behind them. This only has meaning for translucency.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bGenerateSphericalParticleNormals
member.summary: Whether to generate spherical normals for particles that use this material.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bTangentSpaceNormal
member.summary: Whether the material takes a tangent space normal or a world space normal as input. (TangentSpace requires extra instructions but is often more convenient).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUseEmissiveForDynamicAreaLighting
member.summary: If enabled, the material's emissive colour is injected into the LightPropagationVolume

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bBlockGI
member.summary: If enabled, the material's opacity defines how much GI is blocked when using the LightPropagationVolume feature

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedAsSpecialEngineMaterial
member.summary: This is a special usage flag that allows a material to be assignable to any primitive type. This is useful for materials used by code to implement certain viewmodes, for example the default material or lighting only material. The cost is that nearly 20x more shaders will be compiled for the material than the average material, which will greatly increase shader compile time and memory usage. This flag should only be enabled when absolutely necessary, and is purposefully not exposed to the UI to prevent abuse.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithSkeletalMesh
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with skeletal meshes. This will result in the shaders required to support skeletal meshes being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithEditorCompositing
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with editor compositing This will result in the shaders required to support editor compositing being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithParticleSprites
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with particle sprites This will result in the shaders required to support particle sprites being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithBeamTrails
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with beam trails This will result in the shaders required to support beam trails being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithMeshParticles
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with mesh particles This will result in the shaders required to support mesh particles being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithStaticLighting
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with static lighting This will result in the shaders required to support static lighting being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithMorphTargets
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with morph targets This will result in the shaders required to support morph targets being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithSplineMeshes
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with spline meshes This will result in the shaders required to support spline meshes being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithInstancedStaticMeshes
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with instanced static meshes This will result in the shaders required to support instanced static meshes being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsesDistortion
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with distortion This will result in the shaders required to support distortion being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithClothing
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with clothing This will result in the shaders required to support clothing being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsedWithUI
member.summary: Indicates that the material and its instances can be use with Slate UI and UMG This will result in the shaders required to support UI materials being compiled which will increase shader compile time and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bAutomaticallySetUsageInEditor
member.summary: Whether to automatically set usage flags based on what the material is applied to in the editor. It can be useful to disable this on a base material with many instances, where adding another usage flag accidentally (eg bUsedWithSkeletalMeshes) can add a lot of shader permutations.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bFullyRough
member.summary: Forces the material to be completely rough. Saves a number of instructions and one sampler.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUseFullPrecision
member.summary: Forces this material to use full (highp) precision in the pixel shader. This is slower than the default (mediump) but can be used to work around precision-related rendering errors. This setting has no effect on older mobile devices that do not support high precision.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUseLightmapDirectionality
member.summary: Use lightmap directionality and per pixel normals. If disabled, lighting from lightmaps will be flat but cheaper.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUseHQForwardReflections
member.summary: Enables high quality reflections in the forward renderer. Enabling this setting reduces the number of samplers available to the material as two more samplers will be used for reflection cubemaps.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUsePlanarForwardReflections
member.summary: Enables planar reflection when using the forward renderer or mobile. Enabling this setting reduces the number of samplers available to the material as one more sampler will be used for the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.D3D11TessellationMode
member.summary: The type of tessellation to apply to this object. Note D3D11 required for anything except MTM_NoTessellation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bEnableCrackFreeDisplacement
member.summary: Prevents cracks in the surface of the mesh when using tessellation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bEnableAdaptiveTessellation
member.summary: Enables adaptive tessellation, which tries to maintain a uniform number of pixels per triangle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.Wireframe
member.summary: Enables a wireframe view of the mesh the material is applied to.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bOutputVelocityOnBasePass
member.summary: Skips outputting velocity during the base pass.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.Expressions
member.summary: Array of material expressions, excluding Comments. Used by the material editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.EditorComments
member.summary: Array of comments associated with this material; viewed in the material editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.MaterialFunctionInfos
member.summary: Array of all functions this material depends on.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.MaterialParameterCollectionInfos
member.summary: Array of all parameter collections this material depends on.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bCanMaskedBeAssumedOpaque
member.summary: true if this Material can be assumed Opaque when set to masked.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bIsMasked
member.summary: true if Material is masked and uses custom opacity

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bIsPreviewMaterial
member.summary: true if Material is the preview material used in the material editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUseMaterialAttributes
member.summary: when true, the material attributes pin is used instead of the regular pins.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.bUseTranslucencyVertexFog

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMaterial.StateId
member.summary: Guid that uniquely identifies this material. Any changes to the state of the material that do not appear separately in the shadermap DDC keys must cause this guid to be regenerated! For example, a modification to the Expressions array. Code changes that cause the guid to be regenerated on load should be avoided, as that requires a resave of the content to stop recompiling every load.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UMaterialInstanceConstant
member.summary: Material Instances may be used to change the appearance of a material without incurring an expensive recompilation of the material. General modification of the material cannot be supported without recompilation, so the instances are limited to changing the values of predefined material parameters. The parameters are statically defined in the compiled material by a unique name, type and default value.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent
member.summary: MovementComponent is an abstract component class that defines functionality for moving a PrimitiveComponent (our UpdatedComponent) each tick. Base functionality includes: - Restricting movement to a plane or axis. - Utility functions for special handling of collision results (SlideAlongSurface(), ComputeSlideVector(), TwoWallAdjust()). - Utility functions for moving when there may be initial penetration (SafeMoveUpdatedComponent(), ResolvePenetration()). - Automatically registering the component tick and finding a component to move on the owning Actor. Normally the root component of the owning actor is moved, however another component may be selected (see SetUpdatedComponent()). During swept (non-teleporting) movement only collision of UpdatedComponent is considered, attached components will teleport to the end location ignoring collision.

member.summary: Constrain a direction vector to the plane constraint, if enabled. @see SetPlaneConstraint

member.summary: Stops movement immediately (zeroes velocity, usually zeros acceleration for components with acceleration).

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.IsExceedingMaxSpeed(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if the current velocity is exceeding the given max speed (usually the result of GetMaxSpeed()), within a small error tolerance. Note that under normal circumstances updates cause by acceleration will not cause this to be true, however external forces or changes in the max speed limit can cause the max speed to be violated.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.K2_GetModifiedMaxSpeed
member.summary: @return the result of GetMaxSpeed() * GetMaxSpeedModifier().

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.GetMaxSpeed
member.summary: @return Maximum speed of component in current movement mode.

member.summary: @return gravity that affects this component

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.UpdatedComponent
P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.UpdatedPrimitive
member.summary: UpdatedComponent, cast as a UPrimitiveComponent. May be invalid if UpdatedComponent was null or not a UPrimitiveComponent.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.Velocity
member.summary: Current velocity of updated component.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.bConstrainToPlane
member.summary: If true, movement will be constrained to a plane. @see PlaneConstraintNormal, PlaneConstraintOrigin, PlaneConstraintAxisSetting

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.bSnapToPlaneAtStart
member.summary: If true and plane constraints are enabled, then the updated component will be snapped to the plane when first attached.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.PlaneConstraintAxisSetting
P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.PlaneConstraintNormal
member.summary: The normal or axis of the plane that constrains movement, if bConstrainToPlane is enabled. If for example you wanted to constrain movement to the X-Z plane (so that Y cannot change), the normal would be set to X=0 Y=1 Z=0. This is recalculated whenever PlaneConstraintAxisSetting changes. It is normalized once the component is registered with the game world. @see bConstrainToPlane, SetPlaneConstraintNormal(), SetPlaneConstraintFromVectors()

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.PlaneConstraintOrigin
P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.bUpdateOnlyIfRendered
member.summary: If true, skips TickComponent() if UpdatedComponent was not recently rendered.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.bAutoUpdateTickRegistration
member.summary: If true, whenever the updated component is changed, this component will enable or disable its tick dependent on whether it has something to update. This will NOT enable tick at startup if bAutoActivate is false, because presumably you have a good reason for not wanting it to start ticking initially.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.bTickBeforeOwner
member.summary: If true, after registration we will add a tick dependency to tick before our owner (if we can both tick). This is important when our tick causes an update in the owner's position, so that when the owner ticks it uses the most recent position without lag. Disabling this can improve performance if both objects tick but the order of ticks doesn't matter.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UMovementComponent.bAutoRegisterUpdatedComponent
member.summary: If true, registers the owner's Root component as the UpdatedComponent if there is not one currently assigned.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleAcceleration.Acceleration
member.summary: The initial acceleration of the particle. Value is obtained using the EmitterTime at particle spawn. Each frame, the current and base velocity of the particle is then updated using the formula velocity += acceleration * DeltaTime where DeltaTime is the time passed since the last frame.

member.summary: Per-particle drag scale. Evaluted using particle relative time.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleAccelerationOverLifetime.AccelOverLife
member.summary: The acceleration of the particle over its lifetime. Value is obtained using the RelativeTime of the partice. The current and base velocity values of the particle are then updated using the formula velocity += acceleration* DeltaTime where DeltaTime is the time passed since the last frame.

member.summary: Whether the noise points should be oscillate.

member.summary: Whether to apply noise to the target point (or end of line in distance mode...) If true, the beam could potentially 'leave' the target...

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleBeamNoise.FrequencyDistance
member.summary: The distance at which to deposit noise points. If 0.0, then use the static frequency value. If not, distribute noise points at the given distance, up to the static Frequency value. At that point, evenly distribute them along the beam.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleBeamNoise.bApplyNoiseScale
member.summary: If true, apply the noise scale to the beam.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleBeamNoise.NoiseScale
member.summary: The scale factor to apply to noise range. The lookup value is determined by dividing the number of noise points present by the maximum number of noise points (Frequency).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.DampingFactor
member.summary: How much to `slow' the velocity of the particle after a collision. Value is obtained using the EmitterTime at particle spawn.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.DampingFactorRotation
member.summary: How much to `slow' the rotation of the particle after a collision. Value is obtained using the EmitterTime at particle spawn.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.MaxCollisions
member.summary: The maximum number of collisions a particle can have. Value is obtained using the EmitterTime at particle spawn.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.CollisionCompletionOption
member.summary: What to do once a particles MaxCollisions is reached. One of the following: EPCC_Kill Kill the particle when MaxCollisions is reached EPCC_Freeze Freeze in place, NO MORE UPDATES EPCC_HaltCollisions, Stop collision checks, keep updating everything EPCC_FreezeTranslation, Stop translations, keep updating everything else EPCC_FreezeRotation, Stop rotations, keep updating everything else EPCC_FreezeMovement Stop all movement, keep updating

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.CollisionTypes
member.summary: Which ObjectTypes to collide with

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.bApplyPhysics
member.summary: If true, physic will be applied between a particle and the object it collides with. This is one-way - particle --> object. The particle does not have physics applied to it - it just generates an impulse applied to the object it collides with. NOTE: having this on prevents the code from running off the game thread.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.bIgnoreTriggerVolumes
member.summary: Any trigger volumes that are hit will be ignored. NOTE: This can be turned off if the TrigerVolume physics object type is not in the CollisionTypes array. Turning this off is strongly recommended as having it on prevents the code from running off the game thread.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.ParticleMass
member.summary: The mass of the particle - for use when bApplyPhysics is true. Value is obtained using the EmitterTime at particle spawn.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.DirScalar
member.summary: The directional scalar value - used to scale the bounds to 'assist' in avoiding inter-penetration or large gaps.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.bPawnsDoNotDecrementCount
member.summary: If true, then collisions with Pawns will still react, but the UsedMaxCollisions count will not be decremented. (ie., They don't 'count' as collisions) NOTE: Having this on prevents the code from running in parallel.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.bOnlyVerticalNormalsDecrementCount
member.summary: If true, then collisions that do not have a vertical hit normal will still react, but UsedMaxCollisions count will not be decremented. (ie., They don't 'count' as collisions) Useful for having particles come to rest on floors.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.VerticalFudgeFactor
member.summary: The fudge factor to use to determine vertical. True vertical will have a Hit.Normal.Z == 1.0 This will allow for Z components in the range of [1.0-VerticalFudgeFactor..1.0] to count as vertical collisions.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.DelayAmount
member.summary: How long to delay before checking a particle for collisions. Value is retrieved using the EmitterTime. During update, the particle flag IgnoreCollisions will be set until the particle RelativeTime has surpassed the DelayAmount.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.bDropDetail
member.summary: If true, when the World->bDropDetail flag is set, the module will be ignored.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.bCollideOnlyIfVisible
member.summary: If true, Particle collision only if particle system is currently being rendered.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.bIgnoreSourceActor
member.summary: If true, then the source actor is ignored in collision checks. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollision.MaxCollisionDistance
member.summary: Max distance at which particle collision will occur.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollisionGPU.Resilience
member.summary: The bounciness of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollisionGPU.ResilienceScaleOverLife
member.summary: Scales the bounciness of the particle over its life.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollisionGPU.Friction
member.summary: Friction applied to all particles during a collision or while moving along a surface.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollisionGPU.RadiusScale
member.summary: Scale applied to the size of the particle to obtain the collision radius.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollisionGPU.RadiusBias
member.summary: Bias applied to the collision radius.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleCollisionGPU.Response
member.summary: How particles respond to a collision event.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColor.StartColor
member.summary: Initial color for a particle as a function of Emitter time.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColor.StartAlpha
member.summary: Initial alpha for a particle as a function of Emitter time.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColor.bClampAlpha
member.summary: If true, the alpha value will be clamped to the [0..1] range.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColorOverLife.ColorOverLife
member.summary: The color to apply to the particle, as a function of the particle RelativeTime.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColorOverLife.AlphaOverLife
member.summary: The alpha to apply to the particle, as a function of the particle RelativeTime.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColorOverLife.bClampAlpha
member.summary: If true, the alpha value will be clamped to the [0..1] range.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColorScaleOverLife.ColorScaleOverLife
member.summary: The scale factor for the color.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColorScaleOverLife.AlphaScaleOverLife
member.summary: The scale factor for the alpha.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleColorScaleOverLife.bEmitterTime
member.summary: Whether it is EmitterTime or ParticleTime related.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLifetime.Lifetime
member.summary: The lifetime of the particle, in seconds. Retrieved using the EmitterTime at the spawn of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.bUseInverseSquaredFalloff
member.summary: Whether to use physically based inverse squared falloff from the light. If unchecked, the LightExponent distribution will be used instead.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.bAffectsTranslucency
member.summary: Whether lights from this module should affect translucency. Use with caution. Modules enabling this should only make a few particle lights at most, and the smaller they are, the less they will cost.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.bPreviewLightRadius
member.summary: Will draw wireframe spheres to preview the light radius if enabled. Note: this is intended for previewing and the value will not be saved, it will always revert to disabled.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.SpawnFraction
member.summary: Fraction of particles in this emitter to create lights on.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.ColorScaleOverLife
member.summary: Scale that is applied to the particle's color to calculate the light's color, and can be setup as a curve over the particle's lifetime.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.BrightnessOverLife
member.summary: Brightness scale for the light, which can be setup as a curve over the particle's lifetime.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.RadiusScale
member.summary: Scales the particle's radius, to calculate the light's radius.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight.LightExponent
member.summary: Provides the light's exponent when inverse squared falloff is disabled.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLight_Seeded.RandomSeedInfo
member.summary: The random seed(s) to use for looking up values in StartLocation

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocation.StartLocation
member.summary: The location the particle should be emitted. Relative in local space to the emitter by default. Relative in world space as a WorldOffset module or when the emitter's UseLocalSpace is off. Retrieved using the EmitterTime at the spawn of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocation.DistributeOverNPoints
member.summary: When set to a non-zero value this will force the particles to only spawn on evenly distributed positions between the two points specified.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocation.DistributeThreshold
member.summary: When DistributeOverNPoints is set to a non-zero value, this specifies the ratio of particles spawned that should use the distribution. (For example setting this to 1 will cause all the particles to be distributed evenly whereas .75 would cause 1/4 of the particles to be randomly placed).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.SourceType
member.summary: Whether the module uses Bones or Sockets for locations. BONESOCKETSOURCE_Bones - Use Bones as the source locations. BONESOCKETSOURCE_Sockets - Use Sockets as the source locations.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.UniversalOffset
member.summary: An offset to apply to each bone/socket

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.SourceLocations
member.summary: The name(s) of the bone/socket(s) to position at. If this is empty, the module will attempt to spawn from all bones or sockets.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.SelectionMethod
member.summary: The method by which to select the bone/socket to spawn at. SEL_Sequential - loop through the bone/socket array in order SEL_Random - randomly select a bone/socket from the array

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.bUpdatePositionEachFrame
member.summary: If true, update the particle locations each frame with that of the bone/socket

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.bOrientMeshEmitters
member.summary: If true, rotate mesh emitter meshes to orient w/ the socket

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.bInheritBoneVelocity
member.summary: If true, particles inherit the associated bone velocity when spawned

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.InheritVelocityScale
member.summary: A scale on how much of the bone's velocity a particle will inherit.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.SkelMeshActorParamName
member.summary: The parameter name of the skeletal mesh actor that supplies the SkelMeshComponent for in-game.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.NumPreSelectedIndices
member.summary: When we have no source locations and we need to track bone velocities due to bInheritBoneVelocity, we pre select a set of bones to use each frame. This property determines how big the list is. Too low and the randomness of selection may suffer, too high and memory will be wasted.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationBoneSocket.EditorSkelMesh
member.summary: The name of the skeletal mesh to use in the editor

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationDirect.Location

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationDirect.LocationOffset
member.summary: An offset to apply to the position retrieved from the Location calculation. The offset is retrieved using the EmitterTime. The offset will remain constant over the life of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationDirect.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Scales the velocity of the object at a given point in the time-line.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleLocationDirect.Direction
member.summary: Currently unused.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleOrbit.ChainMode
member.summary: Orbit modules will chain together in the order they appear in the module stack. The combination of a module with the one prior to it is defined by using one of the following enumerations: EOChainMode_Add Add the values to the previous results EOChainMode_Scale Multiply the values by the previous results EOChainMode_Link 'Break' the chain and apply the values from the previous results

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleOrbit.OffsetAmount
member.summary: The amount to offset the sprite from the particle position.

member.summary: The options associated with the RotationRateAmount look-up.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleOrientationAxisLock.LockAxisFlags
member.summary: The lock axis flag setting. Can be one of the following: EPAL_NONE No locking to an axis. EPAL_X Lock the sprite facing towards +X. EPAL_Y Lock the sprite facing towards +Y. EPAL_Z Lock the sprite facing towards +Z. EPAL_NEGATIVE_X Lock the sprite facing towards -X. EPAL_NEGATIVE_Y Lock the sprite facing towards -Y. EPAL_NEGATIVE_Z Lock the sprite facing towards -Z. EPAL_ROTATE_X Lock the sprite rotation on the X-axis. EPAL_ROTATE_Y Lock the sprite rotation on the Y-axis. EPAL_ROTATE_Z Lock the sprite rotation on the Z-axis.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleParameterDynamic.DynamicParams
member.summary: The dynamic parameters this module uses.

member.summary: Flags for optimizing update

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModulePivotOffset.PivotOffset
member.summary: Offset applied in UV space to the particle vertex positions. Defaults to (0.5,0.5) putting the pivot in the centre of the partilce.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.Material
member.summary: The material to utilize for the emitter at this LOD level.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.ScreenAlignment
member.summary: The screen alignment to utilize for the emitter at this LOD level. One of the following: PSA_FacingCameraPosition - Faces the camera position, but is not dependent on the camera rotation. This method produces more stable particles under camera rotation. PSA_Square - Uniform scale (via SizeX) facing the camera PSA_Rectangle - Non-uniform scale (via SizeX and SizeY) facing the camera PSA_Velocity - Orient the particle towards both the camera and the direction the particle is moving. Non-uniform scaling is allowed. PSA_TypeSpecific - Use the alignment method indicated int he type data module.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bUseLocalSpace
member.summary: If true, update the emitter in local space

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bKillOnDeactivate
member.summary: If true, kill the emitter when the particle system is deactivated

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bKillOnCompleted
member.summary: If true, kill the emitter when it completes

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.SortMode
member.summary: The sorting mode to use for this emitter. PSORTMODE_None - No sorting required. PSORTMODE_ViewProjDepth - Sort by view projected depth of the particle. PSORTMODE_DistanceToView - Sort by distance of particle to view in world space. PSORTMODE_Age_OldestFirst - Sort by age, oldest drawn first. PSORTMODE_Age_NewestFirst - Sort by age, newest drawn first.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bUseLegacyEmitterTime
member.summary: If true, the EmitterTime for the emitter will be calculated by modulating the SecondsSinceCreation by the EmitterDuration. As this can lead to issues w/ looping and variable duration, a new approach has been implemented. If false, this new approach is utilized, and the EmitterTime is simply incremented by DeltaTime each tick. When the emitter loops, it adjusts the EmitterTime by the current EmitterDuration resulting in proper looping/delay behavior.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.EmitterDuration
member.summary: How long, in seconds, the emitter will run before looping.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.EmitterDurationLow
member.summary: The low end of the emitter duration if using a range.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bEmitterDurationUseRange
member.summary: If true, select the emitter duration from the range [EmitterDurationLow..EmitterDuration]

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bDurationRecalcEachLoop
member.summary: If true, recalculate the emitter duration on each loop.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.EmitterLoops
member.summary: The number of times to loop the emitter. 0 indicates loop continuously

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.SpawnRate
member.summary: The rate at which to spawn particles

member.summary: The method to utilize when burst-emitting particles

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.BurstList
member.summary: The array of burst entries.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.EmitterDelay
member.summary: Indicates the time (in seconds) that this emitter should be delayed in the particle system.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.EmitterDelayLow
member.summary: The low end of the emitter delay if using a range.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bEmitterDelayUseRange
member.summary: If true, select the emitter delay from the range [EmitterDelayLow..EmitterDelay]

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bDelayFirstLoopOnly
member.summary: If true, the emitter will be delayed only on the first loop.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.InterpolationMethod
member.summary: The interpolation method to used for the SubUV image selection. One of the following: PSUVIM_None - Do not apply SubUV modules to this emitter. PSUVIM_Linear - Smoothly transition between sub-images in the given order, with no blending between the current and the next PSUVIM_Linear_Blend - Smoothly transition between sub-images in the given order, blending between the current and the next PSUVIM_Random - Pick the next image at random, with no blending between the current and the next PSUVIM_Random_Blend - Pick the next image at random, blending between the current and the next

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.SubImages_Horizontal
member.summary: The number of sub-images horizontally in the texture

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.RandomImageTime
member.summary: The amount of time (particle-relative, 0.0 to 1.0) to 'lock' on a random sub image 0.0 = change every frame 1.0 = select a random image at spawn and hold for the life of the particle

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.RandomImageChanges
member.summary: The number of times to change a random image over the life of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bOverrideSystemMacroUV
member.summary: Override the system MacroUV settings

member.summary: Local space position that UVs generated with the ParticleMacroUV material node will be centered on.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.MacroUVRadius
member.summary: World space radius that UVs generated with the ParticleMacroUV material node will tile based on.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bUseMaxDrawCount
member.summary: If true, use the MaxDrawCount to limit the number of particles rendered. NOTE: This does not limit the number spawned/updated, only what is drawn.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.MaxDrawCount
member.summary: The maximum number of particles to DRAW for this emitter. If set to 0, it will use whatever number are present.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.EmitterNormalsMode
member.summary: Normal generation mode for this emitter LOD.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.NormalsSphereCenter
member.summary: When EmitterNormalsMode is ENM_Spherical, particle normals are created to face away from NormalsSphereCenter. NormalsSphereCenter is in local space.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.NormalsCylinderDirection
member.summary: When EmitterNormalsMode is ENM_Cylindrical, particle normals are created to face away from the cylinder going through NormalsSphereCenter in the direction NormalsCylinderDirection. NormalsCylinderDirection is in local space.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.bOrbitModuleAffectsVelocityAlignment
member.summary: Ensures that movement generated from the orbit module is applied to velocity-aligned particles

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.UVFlippingMode
member.summary: Controls UV Flipping for this emitter.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRequired.NamedMaterialOverrides
member.summary: Named material overrides for this emitter. Overrides this emitter's material(s) with those in the correspondingly named slot(s) of the owning system.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRotation.StartRotation
member.summary: Initial rotation of the particle (1 = 360 degrees). The value is retrieved using the EmitterTime.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRotationOverLifetime.RotationOverLife
member.summary: The rotation of the particle (1.0 = 360 degrees). The value is retrieved using the RelativeTime of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRotationOverLifetime.Scale
member.summary: If true, the particle rotation is multiplied by the value retrieved from RotationOverLife. If false, the particle rotation is incremented by the value retrieved from RotationOverLife.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRotationRate.StartRotationRate
member.summary: Initial rotation rate, in rotations per second. The value is retrieved using the EmitterTime.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleRotationRateMultiplyLife.LifeMultiplier
member.summary: The scale factor that should be applied to the rotation rate. The value is retrieved using the RelativeTime of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSize.StartSize
member.summary: The initial size that should be used for a particle. The value is retrieved using the EmitterTime during the spawn of a particle. It is added to the Size and BaseSize fields of the spawning particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeMultiplyLife.LifeMultiplier
member.summary: The scale factor for the size that should be used for a particle. The value is retrieved using the RelativeTime of the particle during its update.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeMultiplyLife.MultiplyX
member.summary: If true, the X-component of the scale factor will be applied to the particle size X-component. If false, the X-component is left unaltered.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeMultiplyLife.MultiplyY
member.summary: If true, the Y-component of the scale factor will be applied to the particle size Y-component. If false, the Y-component is left unaltered.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeMultiplyLife.MultiplyZ
member.summary: If true, the Z-component of the scale factor will be applied to the particle size Z-component. If false, the Z-component is left unaltered.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeScale.SizeScale
member.summary: The amount the BaseSize should be scaled before being used as the size of the particle. The value is retrieved using the RelativeTime of the particle during its update. NOTE: this module overrides any size adjustments made prior to this module in that frame.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeScale.EnableX
member.summary: Ignored

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeScale.EnableY
member.summary: Ignored

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSizeScale.EnableZ
member.summary: Ignored

member.summary: The scale factor to apply to the source movement before adding to the particle location. The value is looked up using the particles RELATIVE time [0..1].

member.summary: The rate at which to spawn particles.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawn.RateScale
member.summary: The scalar to apply to the rate.

member.summary: The method to utilize when burst-emitting particles.

member.summary: The array of burst entries.
