member.summary: Scale all burst entries by this amount.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawn.bApplyGlobalSpawnRateScale
member.summary: If true, the SpawnRate will be scaled by the global CVar r.EmitterSpawnRateScale

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawnPerUnit.UnitScalar
member.summary: The scalar to apply to the distance traveled. The value from SpawnPerUnit is divided by this value to give the actual number of particles per unit.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawnPerUnit.SpawnPerUnit
member.summary: The amount to spawn per meter distribution. The value is retrieved using the EmitterTime.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawnPerUnit.bIgnoreSpawnRateWhenMoving
member.summary: If true, process the default spawn rate when not moving... When not moving, skip the default spawn rate. If false, return the bProcessSpawnRate setting.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawnPerUnit.MaxFrameDistance
member.summary: The maximum valid movement for a single frame. If 0.0, then the check is not performed. Currently, if the distance moved between frames is greater than this then NO particles will be spawned. This is primiarily intended to cover cases where the PSystem is attached to teleporting objects.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawnPerUnit.bIgnoreMovementAlongX
member.summary: If true, ignore the X-component of the movement

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawnPerUnit.bIgnoreMovementAlongY
member.summary: If true, ignore the Y-component of the movement

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSpawnPerUnit.bIgnoreMovementAlongZ
member.summary: If true, ignore the Z-component of the movement

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSubUV.Animation
member.summary: SubUV animation asset to use. When specified, optimal bounding geometry for each SubUV frame will be used when rendering the sprites for this emitter instead of full quads. This reduction in overdraw can reduce the GPU cost of rendering the emitter by 2x or 3x, depending on how much unused space was in the texture. The bounding geometry is generated off of the texture alpha setup in the SubUV Animation asset, so that has to match what the material is using for opacity, or clipping will occur. When specified, SubImages_Horizontal and SubImages_Vertical will come from the asset instead of the Required Module.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSubUV.SubImageIndex
member.summary: The index of the sub-image that should be used for the particle. The value is retrieved using the RelativeTime of the particles.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleSubUV.bUseRealTime
member.summary: If true, use *real* time when updating the image index. The movie will update regardless of the slomo settings of the game.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTrailSource.SourceMethod
member.summary: The source method for the trail.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTrailSource.SourceName
member.summary: The name of the source - either the emitter or Actor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTrailSource.SourceStrength
member.summary: The strength of the tangent from the source point for each Trail.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTrailSource.bLockSourceStength
member.summary: Whether to lock the source to the life of the particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTrailSource.SourceOffsetCount
member.summary: SourceOffsetCount The number of source offsets that can be expected to be found on the instance. These must be named TrailSourceOffset#

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTrailSource.SelectionMethod
member.summary: Particle selection method, when using the SourceMethod of Particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTrailSource.bInheritRotation
member.summary: Interhit particle rotation - only valid for SourceMethod of PET2SRCM_Particle.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataAnimTrail.bDeadTrailsOnDeactivate
member.summary: If true, when the system is deactivated, mark trails as dead. This means they will still render, but will not have more particles added to them, even if the system re-activates...

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataAnimTrail.bEnablePreviousTangentRecalculation
member.summary: If true, recalculate the previous tangent when a new particle is spawned

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataAnimTrail.bTangentRecalculationEveryFrame
member.summary: If true, recalculate tangents every frame to allow velocity/acceleration to be applied

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataAnimTrail.TilingDistance
member.summary: The (estimated) covered distance to tile the 2nd UV set at. If 0.0, a second UV set will not be passed in.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataAnimTrail.DistanceTessellationStepSize
member.summary: The distance step size for tessellation. # Tessellation Points = TruncToInt((Distance Between Spawned Particles) / DistanceTessellationStepSize)). If 0 then there is no distance tessellation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataAnimTrail.TangentTessellationStepSize
member.summary: The tangent scalar for tessellation. This is the degree change in the tangent direction [0...180] required to warrant an additional tessellation point. If 0 then there is no tangent tessellation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataAnimTrail.WidthTessellationStepSize
member.summary: The width step size for tessellation. This is the number of world units change in the width required to warrant an additional tessellation point. If 0 then there is no width tessellation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.BeamMethod
member.summary: The method with which to form the beam(s). Must be one of the following: PEB2M_Distance - Use the distance property to emit a beam along the X-axis of the emitter. PEB2M_Target - Emit a beam from the source to the supplied target. PEB2M_Branch - Currently unimplemented.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.TextureTile
member.summary: The number of times to tile the texture along each beam. Overridden by TextureTilingDistance if it is > 0.0. 1st UV set only. 2nd UV set does not Tile.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.TextureTileDistance
member.summary: The distance per texture tile. 1st UV set only. 2nd UV set does not Tile.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.Sheets
member.summary: The number of sheets to render

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.MaxBeamCount
member.summary: The number of live beams

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.Speed
member.summary: The speed at which the beam should move from source to target when firing up. '0' indicates instantaneous

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.bAlwaysOn
member.summary: If true, there will ALWAYS be a beam...

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.UpVectorStepSize
member.summary: The approach to use for determining the Up vector(s) for the beam. 0 indicates that the Up FVector should be calculated at EVERY point in the beam. 1 indicates a single Up FVector should be determined at the start of the beam and used at every point. N indicates an Up FVector should be calculated every N points of the beam and interpolated between them. [NOTE: This mode is currently unsupported.]

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.BranchParentName
member.summary: The name of the emitter to branch from (if mode is PEB2M_Branch) MUST BE IN THE SAME PARTICLE SYSTEM!

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.Distance
member.summary: The distance along the X-axis to stretch the beam Distance is only used if BeamMethod is PEB2M_Distance

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.TaperMethod
member.summary: Tapering mode - one of the following: PEBTM_None - No tapering is applied PEBTM_Full - Taper the beam relative to source-->target, regardless of current beam length PEBTM_Partial - Taper the beam relative to source-->location, 0=source,1=endpoint

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.TaperFactor
member.summary: Tapering factor, 0 = source of beam, 1 = target

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.TaperScale
member.summary: Tapering scaling This is intended to be either a constant, uniform or a ParticleParam. If a curve is used, 0/1 mapping of source/target... which could be integrated into the taper factor itself, and therefore makes no sense.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataBeam2.RenderGeometry
member.summary: Beam Rendering Variables.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataGpu.EmitterInfo
member.summary: Information for runtime simulation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataGpu.ResourceData
member.summary: Data used to initialize runtime resources.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataGpu.CameraMotionBlurAmount
member.summary: TEMP: How much to stretch sprites based on camera motion blur.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataGpu.bClearExistingParticlesOnInit
member.summary: When true, all existing partilces are cleared when the emitter is initialized.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.Mesh
member.summary: The static mesh to render at the particle positions

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.CastShadows
member.summary: If true, has the meshes cast shadows

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.DoCollisions
member.summary: UNUSED (the collision module dictates doing collisions)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.MeshAlignment
member.summary: The alignment to use on the meshes emitted. The RequiredModule->ScreenAlignment MUST be set to PSA_TypeSpecific to use. One of the following: PSMA_MeshFaceCameraWithRoll Face the camera allowing for rotation around the mesh-to-camera FVector (amount provided by the standard particle sprite rotation). PSMA_MeshFaceCameraWithSpin Face the camera allowing for the mesh to rotate about the tangential axis. PSMA_MeshFaceCameraWithLockedAxis Face the camera while maintaining the up FVector as the locked direction.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.bOverrideMaterial
member.summary: If true, use the emitter material when rendering rather than the one applied to the static mesh model.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.Pitch
member.summary: deprecated properties for initial orientation

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.RollPitchYawRange
member.summary: The 'pre' rotation pitch (in degrees) to apply to the static mesh used.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.AxisLockOption
member.summary: The axis to lock the mesh on. This overrides TypeSpecific mesh alignment as well as the LockAxis module. EPAL_NONE - No locking to an axis. EPAL_X - Lock the mesh X-axis facing towards +X. EPAL_Y - Lock the mesh X-axis facing towards +Y. EPAL_Z - Lock the mesh X-axis facing towards +Z. EPAL_NEGATIVE_X - Lock the mesh X-axis facing towards -X. EPAL_NEGATIVE_Y - Lock the mesh X-axis facing towards -Y. EPAL_NEGATIVE_Z - Lock the mesh X-axis facing towards -Z. EPAL_ROTATE_X - Ignored for mesh emitters. Treated as EPAL_NONE. EPAL_ROTATE_Y - Ignored for mesh emitters. Treated as EPAL_NONE. EPAL_ROTATE_Z - Ignored for mesh emitters. Treated as EPAL_NONE.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.bCameraFacing
member.summary: If true, then point the X-axis of the mesh towards the camera. When set, AxisLockOption as well as all other locked axis/screen alignment settings are ignored.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.CameraFacingUpAxisOption
member.summary: The axis of the mesh to point up when camera facing the X-axis. CameraFacing_NoneUP No attempt to face an axis up or down. CameraFacing_ZUp Z-axis of the mesh should attempt to point up. CameraFacing_NegativeZUp Z-axis of the mesh should attempt to point down. CameraFacing_YUp Y-axis of the mesh should attempt to point up. CameraFacing_NegativeYUp Y-axis of the mesh should attempt to point down.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.CameraFacingOption
member.summary: The camera facing option to use: All camera facing options without locked axis assume X-axis will be facing the camera. XAxisFacing_NoUp - X-axis camera facing, no attempt to face an axis up or down. XAxisFacing_ZUp - X-axis camera facing, Z-axis of the mesh should attempt to point up. XAxisFacing_NegativeZUp - X-axis camera facing, Z-axis of the mesh should attempt to point down. XAxisFacing_YUp - X-axis camera facing, Y-axis of the mesh should attempt to point up. XAxisFacing_NegativeYUp - X-axis camera facing, Y-axis of the mesh should attempt to point down. All axis-locked camera facing options assume the AxisLockOption is set. EPAL_NONE will be treated as EPAL_X. LockedAxis_ZAxisFacing - X-axis locked on AxisLockOption axis, rotate Z-axis of the mesh to face towards camera. LockedAxis_NegativeZAxisFacing - X-axis locked on AxisLockOption axis, rotate Z-axis of the mesh to face away from camera. LockedAxis_YAxisFacing - X-axis locked on AxisLockOption axis, rotate Y-axis of the mesh to face towards camera. LockedAxis_NegativeYAxisFacing - X-axis locked on AxisLockOption axis, rotate Y-axis of the mesh to face away from camera. All velocity-aligned options do NOT require the ScreenAlignment be set to PSA_Velocity. Doing so will result in additional work being performed... (it will orient the mesh twice). VelocityAligned_ZAxisFacing - X-axis aligned to the velocity, rotate the Z-axis of the mesh to face towards camera. VelocityAligned_NegativeZAxisFacing - X-axis aligned to the velocity, rotate the Z-axis of the mesh to face away from camera. VelocityAligned_YAxisFacing - X-axis aligned to the velocity, rotate the Y-axis of the mesh to face towards camera. VelocityAligned_NegativeYAxisFacing - X-axis aligned to the velocity, rotate the Y-axis of the mesh to face away from camera.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.bApplyParticleRotationAsSpin
member.summary: If true, apply 'sprite' particle rotation about the orientation axis (direction mesh is pointing). If false, apply 'sprite' particle rotation about the camera facing axis.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.bFaceCameraDirectionRatherThanPosition
member.summary: If true, all camera facing options will point the mesh against the camera's view direction rather than pointing at the cameras location. If false, the camera facing will point to the cameras position as normal.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataMesh.bCollisionsConsiderPartilceSize
member.summary: If true, all collisions for mesh particle on this emitter will take the particle size into account. If false, particle size will be ignored in collision checks.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.MaxTessellationBetweenParticles
member.summary: The maximum amount to tessellate between two particles of the trail. Depending on the distance between the particles and the tangent change, the system will select a number of tessellation points [0..MaxTessellationBetweenParticles]

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.SheetsPerTrail
member.summary: The number of sheets to render for the trail.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.MaxTrailCount
member.summary: The number of live trails

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.MaxParticleInTrailCount
member.summary: Max particles per trail

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bDeadTrailsOnDeactivate
member.summary: If true, when the system is deactivated, mark trails as dead. This means they will still render, but will not have more particles added to them, even if the system re-activates...

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bDeadTrailsOnSourceLoss
member.summary: If true, when the source of a trail is 'lost' (ie, the source particle dies), mark the current trail as dead.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bClipSourceSegement
member.summary: If true, do not join the trail to the source position

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bEnablePreviousTangentRecalculation
member.summary: If true, recalculate the previous tangent when a new particle is spawned

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bTangentRecalculationEveryFrame
member.summary: If true, recalculate tangents every frame to allow velocity/acceleration to be applied

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bSpawnInitialParticle
member.summary: If true, ribbon will spawn a particle when it first starts moving

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.RenderAxis
member.summary: The 'render' axis for the trail (what axis the trail is stretched out on) Trails_CameraUp - Traditional camera-facing trail. Trails_SourceUp - Use the up axis of the source for each spawned particle. Trails_WorldUp - Use the world up axis.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.TangentSpawningScalar
member.summary: The tangent scalar for spawning. Angles between tangent A and B are mapped to [0.0f .. 1.0f] This is then multiplied by TangentTessellationScalar to give the number of particles to spawn

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bRenderGeometry
member.summary: If true, render the trail geometry (this should typically be on)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bRenderSpawnPoints
member.summary: If true, render stars at each spawned particle point along the trail

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bRenderTangents
member.summary: If true, render a line showing the tangent at each spawned particle point along the trail

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bRenderTessellation
member.summary: If true, render the tessellated path between spawned particles

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.TilingDistance
member.summary: The (estimated) covered distance to tile the 2nd UV set at. If 0.0, a second UV set will not be passed in.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.DistanceTessellationStepSize
member.summary: The distance step size for tessellation. # Tessellation Points = TruncToInt((Distance Between Spawned Particles) / DistanceTessellationStepSize))

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.bEnableTangentDiffInterpScale
member.summary: If this flag is enabled, the system will scale the number of interpolated vertices based on the difference in the tangents of neighboring particles. Each pair of neighboring particles will compute the following CheckTangent value: CheckTangent = ((ParticleA Tangent DOT ParticleB Tangent) - 1.0f) * 0.5f If CheckTangent is LESS THAN 0.5, then the DistanceTessellationStepSize will be scaled based on the result. This will map so that from parallel to orthogonal (0..90 degrees) will scale from [0..1]. Anything greater than 90 degrees will clamp at a scale of 1.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleModuleTypeDataRibbon.TangentTessellationScalar
member.summary: The tangent scalar for tessellation. Angles between tangent A and B are mapped to [0.0f .. 1.0f] This is then multiplied by TangentTessellationScalar to give the number of points to tessellate

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem
member.summary: A ParticleSystem is a complete particle effect that contains any number of ParticleEmitters. By allowing multiple emitters in a system, the designer can create elaborate particle effects that are held in a single system. Once created using Cascade, a ParticleSystem can then be inserted into a level or created in script.

member.summary: UpdateTime_FPS - the frame per second to update at in FixedTime mode

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem.WarmupTickRate

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem.bOrientZAxisTowardCamera
member.summary: If true, the system's Z axis will be oriented toward the camera

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem.LODDistanceCheckTime
member.summary: How often (in seconds) the system should perform the LOD distance check.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem.LODMethod
member.summary: The method of LOD level determination to utilize for this particle system PARTICLESYSTEMLODMETHOD_Automatic - Automatically set the LOD level, checking every LODDistanceCheckTime seconds. PARTICLESYSTEMLODMETHOD_DirectSet - LOD level is directly set by the game code. PARTICLESYSTEMLODMETHOD_ActivateAutomatic - LOD level is determined at Activation time, then left alone unless directly set by game code.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem.LODDistances
member.summary: The array of distances for each LOD level in the system. Used when LODMethod is set to PARTICLESYSTEMLODMETHOD_Automatic. Example: System with 3 LOD levels LODDistances(0) = 0.0 LODDistances(1) = 2500.0 LODDistances(2) = 5000.0 In this case, when the system is [ 0.0 .. 2499.9] from the camera, LOD level 0 will be used. [2500.0 .. 4999.9] from the camera, LOD level 1 will be used. [5000.0 .. INFINITY] from the camera, LOD level 2 will be used.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem.EditorLODSetting
member.summary: LOD setting for intepolation (set by Cascade) Range [0..100]

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystem.bRegenerateLODDuplicate
member.summary: Internal value that tracks the regenerate LOD levels preference. If true, when autoregenerating LOD levels in code, the low level will be a duplicate of the high.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystemComponent.bUpdateOnDedicatedServer
member.summary: whether to update the particle system on dedicated servers

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystemComponent.bAllowRecycling
member.summary: If true, this Particle System will be available for recycling after it has completed. Auto-destroyed systems cannot be recycled. Some systems (currently particle trail effects) can recycle components to avoid respawning them to play new effects. This is only an optimization and does not change particle system behavior, aside from not triggering normal component initialization events more than once.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UParticleSystemComponent.bAutoManageAttachment
member.summary: True if we should automatically attach to AutoAttachParent when activated, and detach from our parent when completed. This overrides any current attachment that may be present at the time of activation (deferring initial attachment until activation, if AutoAttachParent is null). When enabled, detachment occurs regardless of whether AutoAttachParent is assigned, and the relative transform from the time of activation is restored. This also disables attachment on dedicated servers, where we don't actually activate even if bAutoActivate is true. @see AutoAttachParent, AutoAttachSocketName, AutoAttachLocationType

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicalMaterial.Density
member.summary: Used with the shape of the object to calculate its mass properties. The higher the number, the heavier the object. g per cubic cm.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicalMaterial.RaiseMassToPower
member.summary: Used to adjust the way that mass increases as objects get larger. This is applied to the mass as calculated based on a 'solid' object. In actuality, larger objects do not tend to be solid, and become more like 'shells' (e.g. a car is not a solid piece of metal). Values are clamped to 1 or less.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicalMaterial.DestructibleDamageThresholdScale

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicalMaterial.PhysicalMaterialProperty

member.summary: Overall tire friction scalar for every type of tire. This value is multiplied against our parents' values.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicalMaterial.TireFrictionScales
member.summary: Tire friction scales for specific types of tires. These values are multiplied against our parents' values.

member.summary: Default gravity.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.DefaultTerminalVelocity
member.summary: Default terminal velocity for Physics Volumes.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.DefaultFluidFriction
member.summary: Default fluid friction for Physics Volumes.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.SimulateScratchMemorySize
member.summary: Amount of memory to reserve for PhysX simulate(), this is per pxscene

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.RagdollAggregateThreshold
member.summary: Threshold for ragdoll bodies above which they will be added to an aggregate before being added to the scene

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.TriangleMeshTriangleMinAreaThreshold
member.summary: Triangles from triangle meshes (BSP) with an area less than or equal to this value will be removed from physics collision data. Set to less than 0 to disable.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bEnableAsyncScene
member.summary: Enables the use of an async scene

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bEnableShapeSharing
member.summary: Enables shape sharing between sync and async scene for static rigid actors

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bEnablePCM
member.summary: Enables persistent contact manifolds. This will generate fewer contact points, but with more accuracy. Reduces stability of stacking, but can help energy conservation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bWarnMissingLocks
member.summary: Whether to warn when physics locks are used incorrectly. Turning this off is not recommended and should only be used by very advanced users.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bEnable2DPhysics
member.summary: Can 2D physics be used (Box2D)?

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.DefaultDegreesOfFreedom
member.summary: Useful for constraining all objects in the world, for example if you are making a 2D game using 3D environments.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.BounceThresholdVelocity
member.summary: Minimum relative velocity required for an object to bounce. A typical value for simulation stability is about 0.2 * gravity

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.FrictionCombineMode
member.summary: Friction combine mode, controls how friction is computed for multiple materials.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.RestitutionCombineMode
member.summary: Restitution combine mode, controls how restitution is computed for multiple materials.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.MaxAngularVelocity
member.summary: Max angular velocity that a simulated object can achieve.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.MaxDepenetrationVelocity
member.summary: Max velocity which may be used to depenetrate simulated physics objects. 0 means no maximum.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.ContactOffsetMultiplier
member.summary: Contact offset multiplier. When creating a physics shape we look at its bounding volume and multiply its minimum value by this multiplier. A bigger number will generate contact points earlier which results in higher stability at the cost of performance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.MinContactOffset
member.summary: Min Contact offset.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.MaxContactOffset
member.summary: Max Contact offset.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bSimulateSkeletalMeshOnDedicatedServer
member.summary: If true, simulate physics for this component on a dedicated server. This should be set if simulating physics and replicating with a dedicated server.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.DefaultShapeComplexity
member.summary: Determines the default physics shape complexity.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bDefaultHasComplexCollision
member.summary: If true, static meshes will use per poly collision as complex collision by default. If false the default behavior is the same as UseSimpleAsComplex.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bSuppressFaceRemapTable
member.summary: If true, the internal physx face to UE face mapping will not be generated. This is a memory optimization available if you do not rely on face indices returned by scene queries.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bSupportUVFromHitResults
member.summary: If true, store extra information to allow FindCollisionUV to derive UV info from a line trace hit result, using the FindCollisionUV utility

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bDisableActiveTransforms
member.summary: If true, physx will not update unreal with any bodies that have moved during the simulation. This should only be used if you have no physx simulation or you are manually updating the unreal data via polling physx.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bDisableCCD
member.summary: If true CCD will be ignored. This is an optimization when CCD is never used which removes the need for physx to check it internally.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.MaxPhysicsDeltaTime
member.summary: Max Physics Delta Time to be clamped.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bSubstepping
member.summary: Whether to substep the physics simulation. This feature is still experimental. Certain functionality might not work correctly

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.bSubsteppingAsync
member.summary: Whether to substep the async physics simulation. This feature is still experimental. Certain functionality might not work correctly

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.MaxSubstepDeltaTime
member.summary: Max delta time (in seconds) for an individual simulation substep.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.MaxSubsteps
member.summary: Max number of substeps for physics simulation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.SyncSceneSmoothingFactor
member.summary: Physics delta time smoothing factor for sync scene.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.AsyncSceneSmoothingFactor
member.summary: Physics delta time smoothing factor for async scene.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSettings.InitialAverageFrameRate
member.summary: Physics delta time initial average.

member.summary: Returns the spring direction from start to resting point

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.GetSpringCurrentEndPoint
member.summary: Returns the spring current end point in world space.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.GetSpringRestingPoint
member.summary: Returns the spring resting point in world space.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.GetNormalizedCompressionScalar
member.summary: Returns the spring compression as a normalized scalar along spring direction. 0 implies spring is at rest 1 implies fully compressed

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.SpringStiffness
member.summary: Specifies how much strength the spring has. The higher the SpringStiffness the more force the spring can push on a body with.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.SpringDamping
member.summary: Specifies how quickly the spring can absorb energy of a body. The higher the damping the less oscillation

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.SpringLengthAtRest
member.summary: Determines how long the spring will be along the X-axis at rest. The spring will apply 0 force on a body when it's at rest.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.SpringRadius
member.summary: Determines the radius of the spring.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.SpringChannel
member.summary: Strength of thrust force applied to the base object.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.bIgnoreSelf
member.summary: If true, the spring will ignore all components in its own actor

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsSpringComponent.SpringCompression
member.summary: The current compression of the spring. A spring at rest will have SpringCompression 0.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsThrusterComponent
member.summary: Used with objects that have physics to apply a force down the negative-X direction ie. point X in the direction you want the thrust in.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPhysicsThrusterComponent.ThrustStrength
member.summary: Strength of thrust force applied to the base object.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent
member.summary: UPlanarReflectionComponent

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.NormalDistortionStrength
member.summary: Controls the strength of normals when distorting the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.PrefilterRoughness
member.summary: The roughness value to prefilter the planar reflection texture with, useful for hiding low resolution. Larger values have larger GPU cost.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.PrefilterRoughnessDistance
member.summary: The distance at which the prefilter roughness value will be achieved.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.ScreenPercentage
member.summary: Downsample percent, can be used to reduce GPU time rendering the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.ExtraFOV
member.summary: Additional FOV used when rendering to the reflection texture. This is useful when normal distortion is causing reads outside the reflection texture. Larger values increase rendering thread and GPU cost, as more objects and triangles have to be rendered into the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.DistanceFromPlaneFadeStart
member.summary: Receiving pixels at this distance from the reflection plane will begin to fade out the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.DistanceFromPlaneFadeEnd
member.summary: Receiving pixels at this distance from the reflection plane will have completely faded out the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.AngleFromPlaneFadeStart
member.summary: Receiving pixels whose normal is at this angle from the reflection plane will begin to fade out the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.AngleFromPlaneFadeEnd
member.summary: Receiving pixels whose normal is at this angle from the reflection plane will have completely faded out the planar reflection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlanarReflectionComponent.bRenderSceneTwoSided
member.summary: Whether to render the scene as two-sided, which can be useful to hide artifacts where normal distortion would read 'under' an object that has been clipped by the reflection plane. With this setting enabled, the backfaces of a mesh would be displayed in the clipped region instead of the background which is potentially a bright sky. Be sure to add the water plane to HiddenActors if enabling this, as the water plane will now block the reflection.

member.summary: Radius of the area that can receive reflections from this capture.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlatformGameInstance.ApplicationWillDeactivateDelegate
member.summary: This is called when the application is about to be deactivated (e.g., due to a phone call or SMS or the sleep button). The game should be paused if possible, etc...

member.summary: Called when the application has been reactivated (reverse any processing done in the Deactivate delegate)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlatformGameInstance.ApplicationWillEnterBackgroundDelegate
member.summary: This is called when the application is being backgrounded (e.g., due to switching to another app or closing it via the home button) The game should release shared resources, save state, etc..., since it can be terminated from the background state without any further warning.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlatformGameInstance.ApplicationHasEnteredForegroundDelegate
member.summary: Called when the application is returning to the foreground (reverse any processing done in the EnterBackground delegate)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPlatformGameInstance.ApplicationWillTerminateDelegate
member.summary: This *may* be called when the application is getting terminated by the OS. There is no guarantee that this will ever be called on a mobile device, save state when ApplicationWillEnterBackgroundDelegate is called instead.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UPointLightComponent
member.summary: A light component which emits light from a single point equally in all directions.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPointLightComponent.AttenuationRadius
member.summary: Bounds the light's visible influence. This clamping of the light's influence is not physically correct but very important for performance, larger lights cost more.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPointLightComponent.bUseInverseSquaredFalloff
member.summary: Whether to use physically based inverse squared distance falloff, where AttenuationRadius is only clamping the light's contribution. Disabling inverse squared falloff can be useful when placing fill lights (don't want a super bright spot near the light). When enabled, the light's Intensity is in units of lumens, where 1700 lumens is a 100W lightbulb. When disabled, the light's Intensity is a brightness scale.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPointLightComponent.LightFalloffExponent
member.summary: Controls the radial falloff of the light when UseInverseSquaredFalloff is disabled. 2 is almost linear and very unrealistic and around 8 it looks reasonable. With large exponents, the light has contribution to only a small area of its influence radius but still costs the same as low exponents.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPointLightComponent.SourceRadius
member.summary: Radius of light source shape. Note that light sources shapes which intersect shadow casting geometry can cause shadowing artifacts.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPointLightComponent.SourceLength
member.summary: Length of light source shape. Note that light sources shapes which intersect shadow casting geometry can cause shadowing artifacts.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPointLightComponent.LightmassSettings
member.summary: The Lightmass settings for this object.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent
member.summary: PrimitiveComponents are SceneComponents that contain or generate some sort of geometry, generally to be rendered or used as collision data. There are several subclasses for the various types of geometry, but the most common by far are the ShapeComponents (Capsule, Sphere, Box), StaticMeshComponent, and SkeletalMeshComponent. ShapeComponents generate geometry that is used for collision detection but are not rendered, while StaticMeshComponents and SkeletalMeshComponents contain pre-built geometry that is rendered, but can also be used for collision detection.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.MinDrawDistance
member.summary: The minimum distance at which the primitive should be rendered, measured in world space units from the center of the primitive's bounding sphere to the camera position.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.LDMaxDrawDistance
member.summary: Max draw distance exposed to LDs. The real max draw distance is the min (disregarding 0) of this and volumes affecting this object.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.CachedMaxDrawDistance
member.summary: The distance to cull this primitive at. A CachedMaxDrawDistance of 0 indicates that the primitive should not be culled by distance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.DepthPriorityGroup
member.summary: The scene depth priority group to draw the primitive in.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.ViewOwnerDepthPriorityGroup
member.summary: The scene depth priority group to draw the primitive in, if it's being viewed by its owner.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bAlwaysCreatePhysicsState
member.summary: Indicates if we'd like to create physics state all the time (for collision and simulation). If you set this to false, it still will create physics state if collision or simulation activated. This can help performance if you'd like to avoid overhead of creating physics state when triggers

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bGenerateOverlapEvents
P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bMultiBodyOverlap
member.summary: If true, this component will generate individual overlaps for each overlapping physics body if it is a multi-body component. When false, this component will generate only one overlap, regardless of how many physics bodies it has and how many of them are overlapping another component/body. This flag has no influence on single body components.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCheckAsyncSceneOnMove
P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bTraceComplexOnMove
P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bReturnMaterialOnMove
member.summary: If true, component sweeps will return the material in their hit result. @see MoveComponent(), FHitResult

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bUseViewOwnerDepthPriorityGroup
member.summary: True if the primitive should be rendered using ViewOwnerDepthPriorityGroup if viewed by its owner.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bAllowCullDistanceVolume
member.summary: Whether to accept cull distance volumes to modify cached cull distance.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bHasMotionBlurVelocityMeshes
member.summary: true if the primitive has motion blur velocity meshes

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bRenderInMainPass
member.summary: If true, this component will be rendered in the main pass (z prepass, basepass, transparency)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bReceivesDecals
member.summary: Whether the primitive receives decals.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bOwnerNoSee
member.summary: If this is True, this component won't be visible when the view actor is the component's owner, directly or indirectly.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bOnlyOwnerSee
member.summary: If this is True, this component will only be visible when the view actor is the component's owner, directly or indirectly.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bTreatAsBackgroundForOcclusion
member.summary: Treat this primitive as part of the background for occlusion purposes. This can be used as an optimization to reduce the cost of rendering skyboxes, large ground planes that are part of the vista, etc.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bUseAsOccluder
P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bSelectable
member.summary: If this is True, this component can be selected in the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bForceMipStreaming
member.summary: If true, forces mips for textures used by this component to be resident when this component's level is loaded.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bHasPerInstanceHitProxies
member.summary: If true a hit-proxy will be generated for each instance of instanced static meshes

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.CastShadow
member.summary: Controls whether the primitive component should cast a shadow or not. This flag is ignored (no shadows will be generated) if all materials on this component have an Unlit shading model.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bAffectDynamicIndirectLighting
member.summary: Controls whether the primitive should inject light into the Light Propagation Volume. This flag is only used if CastShadow is true. *

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bAffectDistanceFieldLighting
member.summary: Controls whether the primitive should affect dynamic distance field lighting methods. This flag is only used if CastShadow is true. *

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastDynamicShadow
member.summary: Controls whether the primitive should cast shadows in the case of non precomputed shadowing. This flag is only used if CastShadow is true. *

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastStaticShadow
member.summary: Whether the object should cast a static shadow from shadow casting lights. This flag is only used if CastShadow is true.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastVolumetricTranslucentShadow
member.summary: Whether the object should cast a volumetric translucent shadow. Volumetric translucent shadows are useful for primitives with smoothly changing opacity like particles representing a volume, But have artifacts when used on highly opaque surfaces.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bSelfShadowOnly
member.summary: When enabled, the component will only cast a shadow on itself and not other components in the world. This is especially useful for first person weapons, and forces bCastInsetShadow to be enabled.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastFarShadow
member.summary: When enabled, the component will be rendering into the far shadow cascades (only for directional lights).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastInsetShadow
member.summary: Whether this component should create a per-object shadow that gives higher effective shadow resolution. Useful for cinematic character shadowing. Assumed to be enabled if bSelfShadowOnly is enabled.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastCinematicShadow
member.summary: Whether this component should cast shadows from lights that have bCastShadowsFromCinematicObjectsOnly enabled. This is useful for characters in a cinematic with special cinematic lights, where the cost of shadowmap rendering of the environment is undesired.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastHiddenShadow
member.summary: If true, the primitive will cast shadows even if bHidden is true. Controls whether the primitive should cast shadows when hidden. This flag is only used if CastShadow is true.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bCastShadowAsTwoSided
member.summary: Whether this primitive should cast dynamic shadows as if it were a two sided material.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bLightAsIfStatic
member.summary: Whether to light this primitive as if it were static, including generating lightmaps. This only has an effect for component types that can bake lighting, like static mesh components. This is useful for moving meshes that don't change significantly.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bLightAttachmentsAsGroup
member.summary: Whether to light this component and any attachments as a group. This only has effect on the root component of an attachment tree. When enabled, attached component shadowing settings like bCastInsetShadow, bCastVolumetricTranslucentShadow, etc, will be ignored. This is useful for improving performance when multiple movable components are attached together.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.IndirectLightingCacheQuality
member.summary: Quality of indirect lighting for Movable primitives. This has a large effect on Indirect Lighting Cache update time.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bReceiveCombinedCSMAndStaticShadowsFromStationaryLights
member.summary: Mobile only: If enabled this component can receive combined static and CSM shadows from a stationary light. (Enabling will increase shading cost.) If disabled this component will only receive static shadows from stationary lights.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bSingleSampleShadowFromStationaryLights
member.summary: Whether the whole component should be shadowed as one from stationary lights, which makes shadow receiving much cheaper. When enabled shadowing data comes from the volume lighting samples precomputed by Lightmass, which are very sparse. This is currently only used on stationary directional lights.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.LightingChannels
member.summary: Channels that this component should be in. Lights with matching channels will affect the component. These channels only apply to opaque materials, direct lighting, and dynamic lighting and shadowing.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bStaticLightingBuildEnqueued
member.summary: If true, asynchronous static build lighting will be enqueued to be applied to this

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bIgnoreRadialImpulse
member.summary: Will ignore radial impulses applied to this component.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bIgnoreRadialForce
member.summary: Will ignore radial forces applied to this component.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.AlwaysLoadOnClient
member.summary: If this is True, this component must always be loaded on clients, even if Hidden and CollisionEnabled is NoCollision.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.AlwaysLoadOnServer
member.summary: If this is True, this component must always be loaded on servers, even if Hidden and CollisionEnabled is NoCollision

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bUseEditorCompositing
member.summary: Composite the drawing of this component onto the scene after post processing (only applies to editor drawing)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bRenderCustomDepth
member.summary: If true, this component will be rendered in the CustomDepth pass (usually used for outlines)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.CustomDepthStencilValue
member.summary: Optionally write this 0-255 value to the stencil buffer in CustomDepth pass (Requires project setting or r.CustomDepth == 3)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.TranslucencySortPriority
member.summary: Translucent objects with a lower sort priority draw behind objects with a higher priority. Translucent objects with the same priority are rendered from back-to-front based on their bounds origin. Ignored if the object is not translucent. The default priority is zero. Warning: This should never be set to a non-default value unless you know what you are doing, as it will prevent the renderer from sorting correctly. It is especially problematic on dynamic gameplay effects.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.VisibilityId
member.summary: Used for precomputed visibility

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.LpvBiasMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplier used to scale the Light Propagation Volume light injection bias, to reduce light bleeding. Set to 0 for no bias, 1 for default or higher for increased biasing (e.g. for thin geometry such as walls)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.BodyInstance
member.summary: Physics scene information for this component, holds a single rigid body with multiple shapes.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.bHasCustomNavigableGeometry
member.summary: If true then DoCustomNavigableGeometryExport will be called to collect navigable geometry of this component.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.BoundsScale
member.summary: Scales the bounds of the object. This is useful when using World Position Offset to animate the vertices of the object outside of its bounds. Warning: Increasing the bounds of an object will reduce performance and shadow quality! Currently only used by StaticMeshComponent and SkeletalMeshComponent.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.LastSubmitTime
member.summary: Last time the component was submitted for rendering (called FScene::AddPrimitive).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.LastRenderTime
member.summary: The value of WorldSettings->TimeSeconds for the frame when this component was last rendered. This is written from the render thread, which is up to a frame behind the game thread, so you should allow this time to be at least a frame behind the game thread's world time before you consider the actor non-visible.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.CanCharacterStepUpOn
P:UnrealEngine.UPrimitiveComponent.MoveIgnoreActors
member.summary: Set of actors to ignore during component sweeps in MoveComponent(). All components owned by these actors will be ignored when this component moves or updates overlaps. Components on the other Actor may also need to be told to do the same when they move. Does not affect movement of this component when simulating physics. @see IgnoreActorWhenMoving()

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent
member.summary: ProjectileMovementComponent updates the position of another component during its tick. Behavior such as bouncing after impacts and homing toward a target are supported. Normally the root component of the owning actor is moved, however another component may be selected (see SetUpdatedComponent()). If the updated component is simulating physics, only the initial launch parameters (when initial velocity is non-zero) will affect the projectile, and the physics sim will take over from there. @see UMovementComponent

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.StopSimulating(UnrealEngine.FHitResult)
member.summary: Clears the reference to UpdatedComponent, fires stop event (OnProjectileStop), and stops ticking (if bAutoUpdateTickRegistration is true).

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.SetVelocityInLocalSpace(UnrealEngine.FVector)
member.summary: Sets the velocity to the new value, rotated into Actor space.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.InitialSpeed
member.summary: Initial speed of projectile. If greater than zero, this will override the initial Velocity value and instead treat Velocity as a direction.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.MaxSpeed
member.summary: Limit on speed of projectile (0 means no limit).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.bRotationFollowsVelocity
member.summary: If true, this projectile will have its rotation updated each frame to match the direction of its velocity.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.bShouldBounce
member.summary: If true, simple bounces will be simulated. Set this to false to stop simulating on contact.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.bInitialVelocityInLocalSpace
member.summary: If true, the initial Velocity is interpreted as being in local space upon startup. @see SetVelocityInLocalSpace()

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.bForceSubStepping
member.summary: If true, forces sub-stepping to break up movement into discrete smaller steps to improve accuracy of the trajectory. Objects that move in a straight line typically do *not* need to set this, as movement always uses continuous collision detection (sweeps) so collision is not missed. Sub-stepping is automatically enabled when under the effects of gravity or when homing towards a target. @see MaxSimulationTimeStep, MaxSimulationIterations

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.bIsHomingProjectile
member.summary: If true, we will accelerate toward our homing target. HomingTargetComponent must be set after the projectile is spawned. @see HomingTargetComponent, HomingAccelerationMagnitude

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.bBounceAngleAffectsFriction
member.summary: Controls the effects of friction on velocity parallel to the impact surface when bouncing. If true, friction will be modified based on the angle of impact, making friction higher for perpendicular impacts and lower for glancing impacts. If false, a bounce will retain a proportion of tangential velocity equal to (1.0 - Friction), acting as a "horizontal restitution".

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.bIsSliding
member.summary: If true, projectile is sliding / rolling along a surface.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.PreviousHitTime
member.summary: Saved HitResult Time (0 to 1) from previous simulation step. Equal to 1.0 when there was no impact.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.PreviousHitNormal
member.summary: Saved HitResult Normal from previous simulation step that resulted in an impact. If PreviousHitTime is 1.0, then the hit was not in the last step.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.ProjectileGravityScale
member.summary: Custom gravity scale for this projectile. Set to 0 for no gravity.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.Buoyancy
member.summary: Buoyancy of UpdatedComponent in fluid. 0.0=sinks as fast as in air, 1.0=neutral buoyancy

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.Bounciness
member.summary: Percentage of velocity maintained after the bounce in the direction of the normal of impact (coefficient of restitution). 1.0 = no velocity lost, 0.0 = no bounce. Ignored if bShouldBounce is false.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.Friction
member.summary: Coefficient of friction, affecting the resistance to sliding along a surface. Normal range is [0,1] : 0.0 = no friction, 1.0+ = very high friction. Also affects the percentage of velocity maintained after the bounce in the direction tangent to the normal of impact. Ignored if bShouldBounce is false. @see bBounceAngleAffectsFriction

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.BounceVelocityStopSimulatingThreshold
P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.OnProjectileBounce
member.summary: Called when projectile impacts something and bounces are enabled.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.OnProjectileStop
member.summary: Called when projectile has come to a stop (velocity is below simulation threshold, bounces are disabled, or it is forcibly stopped).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.HomingAccelerationMagnitude
member.summary: The magnitude of our acceleration towards the homing target. Overall velocity magnitude will still be limited by MaxSpeed.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.MaxSimulationTimeStep
member.summary: Max time delta for each discrete simulation step. Lowering this value can address issues with fast-moving objects or complex collision scenarios, at the cost of performance. WARNING: if (MaxSimulationTimeStep * MaxSimulationIterations) is too low for the min framerate, the last simulation step may exceed MaxSimulationTimeStep to complete the simulation. @see MaxSimulationIterations, bForceSubStepping

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UProjectileMovementComponent.MaxSimulationIterations
member.summary: Max number of iterations used for each discrete simulation step. Increasing this value can address issues with fast-moving objects or complex collision scenarios, at the cost of performance. WARNING: if (MaxSimulationTimeStep * MaxSimulationIterations) is too low for the min framerate, the last simulation step may exceed MaxSimulationTimeStep to complete the simulation. @see MaxSimulationTimeStep, bForceSubStepping

member.summary: The property path to trace to resolve this binding on the Source Object

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UPropertyBinding.DestinationProperty
member.summary: Used to determine if a binding already exists on the object and if this binding can be safely removed.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererOverrideSettings.bSupportAllShaderPermutations
member.summary: "Enabling will locally override all ShaderPermutationReduction settings from the Renderer section to be enabled. Saved to local user config only.."

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings
member.summary: Rendering settings.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bMobileHDR
member.summary: If true, mobile renders in full HDR. Disable this setting for games that do not require lighting features for better performance on slow devices.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.MobileNumDynamicPointLights
member.summary: The number of dynamic point lights to support on mobile devices. Setting this to 0 for games which do not require dynamic point lights will reduce the number of shaders generated. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bMobileDynamicPointLightsUseStaticBranch
member.summary: If this setting is enabled, the same shader will be used for any number of dynamic point lights (up to the maximum specified above) hitting a surface. This is slightly slower but reduces the number of shaders generated. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bMobileEnableStaticAndCSMShadowReceivers
member.summary: Allow primitives to receive both static and CSM shadows from a stationary light. Disabling will free a mobile texture sampler.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDiscardUnusedQualityLevels
member.summary: When running in game mode, whether to keep shaders for all quality levels in memory or only those needed for the current quality level. Unchecked: Keep all quality levels in memory allowing a runtime quality level change. (default) Checked: Discard unused quality levels when loading content for the game, saving some memory.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bOcclusionCulling
member.summary: Allows occluded meshes to be culled and no rendered.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.MinScreenRadiusForLights
member.summary: Screen radius at which lights are culled. Larger values can improve performance but causes lights to pop off when they affect a small area of the screen.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.MinScreenRadiusForEarlyZPass
member.summary: Screen radius at which objects are culled for the early Z pass. Larger values can improve performance but very large values can degrade performance if large occluders are not rendered.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.MinScreenRadiusForCSMdepth
member.summary: Screen radius at which objects are culled for cascaded shadow map depth passes. Larger values can improve performance but can cause artifacts as objects stop casting shadows.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bPrecomputedVisibilityWarning
member.summary: Displays a warning when no precomputed visibility data is available for the current camera location. This can be helpful if you are making a game that relies on precomputed visibility, e.g. a first person mobile game.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bTextureStreaming
member.summary: When enabled textures will stream in based on what is visible on screen.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bUseDXT5NormalMaps
member.summary: Whether to use DXT5 for normal maps, otherwise BC5 will be used, which is not supported on all hardware. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bClearCoatEnableSecondNormal
member.summary: Use a separate normal map for the bottom layer of a clear coat material. This is a higher quality feature that is expensive.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.ReflectionCaptureResolution
member.summary: The cubemap resolution for all reflection capture probes. Must be power of 2. Note that for very high values the memory and performance impact may be severe.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bForwardShading
member.summary: Whether to use forward shading on desktop platforms. Requires Shader Model 5 hardware. Forward shading has lower constant cost, but fewer features supported. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bAllowStaticLighting
member.summary: Whether to allow any static lighting to be generated and used, like lightmaps and shadowmaps. Games that only use dynamic lighting should set this to 0 to save some static lighting overhead. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bUseNormalMapsForStaticLighting
member.summary: Whether to allow any static lighting to use normal maps for lighting computations.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bGenerateMeshDistanceFields
member.summary: Whether to build distance fields of static meshes, needed for distance field AO, which is used to implement Movable SkyLight shadows, and ray traced distance field shadows on directional lights. Enabling will increase mesh build times and memory usage. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bGenerateLandscapeGIData
member.summary: Whether to generate a low-resolution base color texture for landscapes for rendering real-time global illumination. This feature requires GenerateMeshDistanceFields is also enabled, and will increase mesh build times and memory usage.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.TessellationAdaptivePixelsPerTriangle
member.summary: When adaptive tessellation is enabled it will try to tessellate a mesh so that each triangle contains the specified number of pixels. The tessellation multiplier specified in the material can increase or decrease the amount of tessellation.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bSeparateTranslucency
member.summary: Allow translucency to be rendered to a separate render targeted and composited after depth of field. Prevents translucency from appearing out of focus.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.TranslucentSortPolicy
member.summary: The sort mode for translucent primitives, affecting how they are ordered and how they change order as the camera moves.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.TranslucentSortAxis
member.summary: The axis that sorting will occur along when Translucent Sort Policy is set to SortAlongAxis.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.CustomDepthStencil
member.summary: Whether the custom depth pass for tagging primitives for postprocessing passes is enabled. Enabling it on demand can save memory but may cause a hitch the first time the feature is used.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDefaultFeatureBloom
member.summary: Whether the default for Bloom is enabled or not (postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDefaultFeatureAmbientOcclusion
member.summary: Whether the default for AmbientOcclusion is enabled or not (postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDefaultFeatureAmbientOcclusionStaticFraction
member.summary: Whether the default for AmbientOcclusionStaticFraction is enabled or not (only useful for baked lighting and if AO is on, allows to have SSAO affect baked lighting as well, costs performance, postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDefaultFeatureAutoExposure
member.summary: Whether the default for AutoExposure is enabled or not (postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.DefaultFeatureAutoExposure
member.summary: The default method for AutoExposure(postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDefaultFeatureMotionBlur
member.summary: Whether the default for MotionBlur is enabled or not (postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDefaultFeatureLensFlare
member.summary: Whether the default for LensFlare is enabled or not (postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.DefaultFeatureAntiAliasing
member.summary: What anti-aliasing mode is used by default (postprocess volume/camera/game setting can still override and enable or disable it independently)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bStencilForLODDither
member.summary: Whether to use stencil for LOD dither fading. This saves GPU time in the base pass for materials with dither fading enabled, but forces a full prepass. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.EarlyZPass
member.summary: Whether to use a depth only pass to initialize Z culling for the base pass.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bEarlyZPassMovable
member.summary: Whether to render movable objects in the early Z pass. Need to reload the level!

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bDBuffer
member.summary: Experimental decal feature (see r.DBuffer, ideally combined with 'Movables in early Z-pass' and 'Early Z-pass')

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.ClearSceneMethod
member.summary: Select how the g-buffer is cleared in game mode (only affects deferred shading).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bBasePassOutputsVelocity
member.summary: Enables materials with time-based World Position Offset and/or World Displacement to output accurate velocities. This incurs a performance cost. If this is disabled, those materials will not output velocities. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bSelectiveBasePassOutputs
member.summary: Enables not exporting to the GBuffer rendertargets that are not relevant. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bGlobalClipPlane
member.summary: Whether to support the global clip plane needed for planar reflections. Enabling this increases BasePass triangle cost by ~15% regardless of whether planar reflections are active. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.GBufferFormat
member.summary: Selects which GBuffer format should be used. Affects performance primarily via how much GPU memory bandwidth used.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bUseGPUMorphTargets
member.summary: Whether to use original CPU method (loop per morph then by vertex) or use a GPU-based method on Shader Model 5 hardware.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bInstancedStereo
member.summary: Enable instanced stereo rendering (only available for D3D SM5 or PS4).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bMultiView
member.summary: Enable multi-view for instanced stereo rendering (only available on the PS4).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.WireframeCullThreshold
member.summary: Screen radius at which wireframe objects are culled. Larger values can improve performance when viewing a scene in wireframe.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bSupportStationarySkylight
member.summary: "Stationary skylight requires permutations of the basepass shaders. Disabling will reduce the number of shader permutations required per material. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor."

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bSupportLowQualityLightmaps
member.summary: "Low quality lightmap requires permutations of the lightmap rendering shaders. Disabling will reduce the number of shader permutations required per material. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor."

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bSupportPointLightWholeSceneShadows
member.summary: PointLight WholeSceneShadows requires many vertex and geometry shader permutations for cubemap rendering. Disabling will reduce the number of shader permutations required per material. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor."

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URendererSettings.bSupportAtmosphericFog
member.summary: "Atmospheric fog requires permutations of the basepass shaders. Disabling will reduce the number of shader permutations required per material. Changing this setting requires restarting the editor."

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox
member.summary: The Retainer Box renders children widgets to a render target first before later rendering that render target to the screen. This allows both frequency and phase to be controlled so that the UI can actually render less often than the frequency of the main game render. It also has the side benefit of allow materials to be applied to the render target after drawing the widgets to apply a simple post process. * Single Child * Caching / Performance

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox.SetTextureParameter(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the name of the texture parameter to set the render target to on the material.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox.SetEffectMaterial(UnrealEngine.UMaterialInterface)
member.summary: Set a new effect material to the retainer widget.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox.GetEffectMaterial
member.summary: Get the current dynamic effect material applied to the retainer box.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox.Phase
member.summary: The Phase this widget will draw on. If the Phase is 0, and the PhaseCount is 1, the widget will be drawn fresh every frame. If the Phase were 0, and the PhaseCount were 2, this retainer would draw a fresh frame every other frame. So in a 60Hz game, the UI would render at 30Hz.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox.PhaseCount
member.summary: The PhaseCount controls how many phases are possible know what to modulus the current frame count by to determine if this is the current frame to draw the widget on. If the Phase is 0, and the PhaseCount is 1, the widget will be drawn fresh every frame. If the Phase were 0, and the PhaseCount were 2, this retainer would draw a fresh frame every other frame. So in a 60Hz game, the UI would render at 30Hz.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox.EffectMaterial
member.summary: The effect to optionally apply to the render target. We will set the texture sampler based on the name set in the @TextureParameter property.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URetainerBox.TextureParameter
member.summary: The texture sampler parameter of the @EffectMaterial, that we'll set to the render target.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.URotatingMovementComponent
member.summary: Performs continuous rotation of a component at a specific rotation rate. Rotation can optionally be offset around a pivot point. Collision testing is not performed during movement.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URotatingMovementComponent.RotationRate
member.summary: How fast to update roll/pitch/yaw of the component we update.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URotatingMovementComponent.PivotTranslation
member.summary: Translation of pivot point around which we rotate, relative to current rotation. For instance, with PivotTranslation set to (X=+100, Y=0, Z=0), rotation will occur around the point +100 units along the local X axis from the center of the object, rather than around the object's origin (the default).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.URotatingMovementComponent.bRotationInLocalSpace
member.summary: Whether rotation is applied in local or world space.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UScaleBox
member.summary: Allows you to place content with a desired size and have it scale to meet the constraints placed on this box's alloted area. If you needed to have a background image scale to fill an area but not become distorted with different aspect ratios, or if you need to auto fit some text to an area, this is the control for you. * Single Child * Aspect Ratio

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UScaleBox.Stretch
member.summary: The stretching rule to apply when content is stretched

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UScaleBox.StretchDirection
member.summary: Controls in what direction content can be scaled

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UScaleBox.UserSpecifiedScale
member.summary: Optional scale that can be specified by the User. Used only for UserSpecified stretching.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UScaleBox.IgnoreInheritedScale
member.summary: Optional bool to ignore the inherited scale. Applies inverse scaling to counteract parents before applying the local scale operation.

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.UScaleBoxSlot
member.summary: The Slot for the UScaleBoxSlot, contains the widget displayed in a button's single slot

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UScaleBoxSlot.Padding
member.summary: The padding area between the slot and the content it contains.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UScaleBoxSlot.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of the object horizontally.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.UScaleBoxSlot.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of the object vertically.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent.HiddenActors
member.summary: The actors to hide in the scene capture.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent.ShowOnlyActors
member.summary: The only actors to be rendered by this scene capture, if present.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent.bCaptureEveryFrame
member.summary: Whether to update the capture's contents every frame. If disabled, the component will render once on load and then only when moved.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent.bCaptureOnMovement
member.summary: Whether to update the capture's contents on movement. Disable if you are going to capture manually from blueprint.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent.MaxViewDistanceOverride
member.summary: if > 0, sets a maximum render distance override. Can be used to cull distant objects from a reflection if the reflecting plane is in an enclosed area like a hallway or room

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent.ShowFlagSettings
member.summary: ShowFlags for the SceneCapture's ViewFamily, to control rendering settings for this view. Hidden but accessible through details customization

member.name: T:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent2D
member.summary: Used to capture a 'snapshot' of the scene from a single plane and feed it to a render target.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent2D.CaptureScene
member.summary: Render the scene to the texture target immediately. This should not be used if bCaptureEveryFrame is enabled, or the scene capture will render redundantly.

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent2D.FOVAngle
member.summary: Camera field of view (in degrees).

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent2D.OrthoWidth
member.summary: The desired width (in world units) of the orthographic view (ignored in Perspective mode)

member.name: P:UnrealEngine.USceneCaptureComponent2D.TextureTarget
member.summary: Output render target of the scene capture that can be read in materals.

member.name: M:UnrealEngine.USceneComponent.K2_SetWorldRotation(UnrealEngine.FRotator,System.Boolean,UnrealEngine.FHitResult@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: * Put this component at the specified rotation in world space. Updates relative rotation to achieve the final world rotation. * @param NewRotation New rotation in world space for the component. * @param SweepHitResult Hit result from any impact if sweep is true. * @param bSweep Whether we sweep to the destination (currently not supported for rotation). * @param bTeleport Whether we teleport the physics state (if physics collision is enabled for this object). * If true, physics velocity for this object is unchanged (so ragdoll parts are not affected by change in location). * If false, physics velocity is updated based on the change in position (affecting ragdoll parts). * If CCD is on and not teleporting, this will affect objects along the entire sweep volume.
